programme.title: Tried and Tasted: The Ultimate Shopping List
programme.desc: Joining chef Michel Roux Jr are First Dates love ambassador Fred Sirieix, food critic Jay Rayner, baker Stacie Stewart and TV presenter Lucy Alexander. The panellists choose between four different brands of prawn cocktail, margherita pizza and vanilla ice cream. There is also a public taste test of oven chips.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: DJ Trishna hosts the first of week of dinner parties in Cardiff, hoping her hip-hop-themed night impresses guests Yuno, Nick, Michelle and Suzanne as she tries to win the £1,000.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second day of the competition in Cardiff, and host Nick is planning to bring some refinement and fine dining to the week's proceedings with a massive tasting menu.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Retail manager Yuno hosts the third evening in Cardiff, hoping to scoop the prize by giving his guests a taste of the Himalayas, as well as entertaining with traditional dancing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Day four in Cardiff is hosted by Michelle, who takes a risk with the third serving of lamb this week - and when she sets a fun challenge, she ends up being accused of cheating.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the final night of the competition in Cardiff and tonight's host Suzanne is pinning her hopes on an evening of sophistication and fine French cuisine.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James Constantinou faces rare items that are allegedly from Arctic explorer Ernest Shackleton's expeditions and values some vintage Chanel handbags. He also discovers a problem when he takes assistant Jo out for a terrifying test drive in a client's Porsche.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James heads to Ibiza to appraise a luxury speedboat worth over £100,000 and a diamond ring, while Lawrence values a piece of boxing memorabilia. Designer handbag expert Claudia must brush up on her history when she is confronted with a rare purse.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James tries to make an £85,000 deal on a modified sports car, while designer handbag expert Claudia heads to Germany to value a large collection of bags owned by a former New York socialite. A female bodybuilder wants to sell jewellery so she can fund her new hobby, and a golf fanatic brings in a case of vintage wine.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: High-end pawnbroker James hopes to sell a Second World War Tiger Moth biplane for £70,000, while two different diamond rings bought for £22,000 give the Prestige Pawnbrokers team a headache. Plus, a lord and lady try to sell some luxury handbags and a guitar signed by members of the Rolling Stones.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to New Orleans to visit Zeke's, a much-loved restaurant that has seen standards slip since the original owner died. The new proprietors, husband and wife duo Darryl and Ellen Cortello, focused all the efforts on the financial side of things, so it is up to Gordon to show them that they first need to love food to make any profit.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part edition, Gordon Ramsay heads to La Galleria 33 in Boston, Massachusetts, an Italian restaurant run by sisters Rita and Lisa. The pair grew up working at their father's eatery nearby, but when they opened their own business, they couldn't replicate his success, and they now blame their failure on everything from the weather to the tablecloths.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay travels to Oceana, a restaurant in the heart of New Orleans, to try to change the fortunes of a business run by two quarrelling brothers. The chef soon discovers that the ingredients are of poor quality and could pose a health hazard, but he struggles to make his point with the owners without causing an even bigger conflict between them.(n)

programme.title: Animal Rescue Live: Supervet Special
programme.desc: Steve Jones, Kate Quilton and Professor Noel Fitzpatrick wrap up their week-long animal rescue series live from the Newcastle Dog & Cat Shelter. Over the course of the week they have met furry friends from all over the country and tonight even more of them will make their way home to start a happier life with their new-found families. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: Cavachon Stampy has been hit by a car and is in a critical condition, leaving owners Jim and his wife Karen facing a difficult dilemma - to take the chance and put their pet through painful surgery, or let him die. Golden retriever Dylan has a limp, and owner Stuart has driven seven hours from Preston to seek Noel Fitzpatrick's help. Meanwhile, Ginny from Chelsea arrives with her beloved dachshund Lilly-Belle, who has lost the use of her back legs.(n)

programme.title: The Mystery of the Crossrail Skulls
programme.desc: Documentary examining the discovery of dozens of Roman-era skulls by engineers working beneath London's Liverpool Street station. The remains have been identified as dating back to Roman times, but it has yet to be determined who these people were and how their heads ended up buried on the site. Archaeologists examine the bones for evidence of the various theories that have been suggested, questioning whether the skulls belonged to gladiators, executed rebels or the victims of a massacre, or formed part of a grisly ritual.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Headteacher Emma arrives in resus having been in a collision with a bus while cycling home from the school she works at. As she is treated, her husband Mick reflects on being informed what had happened. Meanwhile, 33-year-old Josh is treated for severe back pain, and 87-year-old Pamela is examined for a possible blood clot in her leg, and tells the doctors about her childhood in London during the Blitz.(n)

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary follows Kirstine and Phil, who have not spent a day apart in four years, but following an emergency during labour the pair find themselves separated. Cameras also focus on independent businesswoman Tyla. While awaiting the arrival of her third child, she starts to reconsider her romantic future. And although Spanish nurses Carlota and Javier epitomise the perfect relationship, the pair realise that labour can be challenging even for the best of partnerships.(n)

programme.title: 999: What's Your Emergency
programme.desc: Following the criminalisation of formerly legal highs, crack and heroin use is on the up in Wiltshire - and some of the users seem to be getting younger and a routine stop and search uncovers a bag of crack cocaine in the possession of a boy still in his teens. Meanwhile, PC Luke Hobbs leads his first drugs raid on a suspected heroin and crack supplier in Swindon's city centre, discovering the property has been commandeered by a dealer from London who is using the address as a base to make a move into the local market.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef travels to New Orleans to visit Zeke's, a much-loved restaurant that has seen standards slip since the original owner died. The new proprietors, husband and wife duo Darryl and Ellen Cortello, focused all the efforts on the financial side of things, so it is up to Gordon to show them that they first need to love food to make any profit.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A poodle called Diamond has been referred for a total hip replacement, and another, with the same owner, needs a new knee. Noel Fitzpatrick operates on both dogs on the same day, and doesn't finish until 3am. Hopity, a 12-week-old Balinese kitten, has a deformity on one of her back legs, which she could end up losing, while the operation itself is a huge risk. Hazell has brought in Dandi, a five month-old German shepherd who is lame in both front legs.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Benefit Tenants
programme.desc: In South Yorkshire, two landlords rush to the scene of a police raid, where the occupant has turned their property into a large cannabis factory. Meanwhile, when the local council holds up their housing benefit claims in Doncaster, an agent decides to evict all of his 160 benefit tenants.(n)

programme.title: Big House, Little House
programme.desc: A couple in west London spend £70,000 to completely remodel the rear of their Victorian property, while in Manchester, another duo use £30,000 to treat themselves to an extension.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton shows a number of properties to Mena and Bal Patel, who want to buy a holiday home in Orihuela on the Costa Blanca in Spain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Kent retirees David and Donna Bradley want to relocate permanently to Menorca, so Laura Hamilton shows them five properties for their £300,000 budget.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin shows Southampton couple David and Sonia five fantastic properties for their budget of £100,000 in the Almeria province of southern Spain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Sandra Dodsworth and husband Peter find a house in south Orlando so they can be closer to their daughter, who moved to Florida seven years ago.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Hollywood
programme.desc: The TV presenter continues his comprehensive exploration of the bombastic side of Hollywood, this time turning his attention to musical numbers that have elevated the popularity of their respective films. Over the years, Tinseltown musicals have touched on a wide variety of cinematic genres, from the family-friendly fantasies to urban dance and even more macabre territory via The Rocky Horror Picture Show. Here, Paul revisits Mary Poppins' tongue-twisting Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious, Pinball Wizard from Tommy, and a variety of numbers from Fame and Flashdance. He also sheds light on how Disney animation studios are keeping the musical genre alive, with blockbuster hits such as Frozen, which came complete with its own Oscar-winning girl-power anthem Let It Go. Includes contributions by Jonathan Ross, Celine Dion, Maureen Lipman and more. The concluding part can be seen on More4 tomorrow at 9pm.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples hoping to relocate to Surrey. Sonia and Daniel Alderson-Smith have a sizeable budget to find a new property in East Molesey - but have also decided there are only 18 streets on which they will consider living. Meanwhile, Phil offers advice to Maeve and Peter Dunne, who are unsure about which part of the county to move to.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer revisit their oldest-ever house-hunters, Margot and Henry from Berkshire, who were looking to move to somewhere a little more modern after 50 years in the same place. They also catch up with young couple Wendy and Simon, who were desperate to find their first home in Derby.(n)

programme.desc: Enforcement officers are faced with the difficult job of evicting a woman with two children - a task that takes a turn for the worse when her ex-partner makes an appearance. programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away
programme.desc: Paul and Steve discover a locked wooden case when they are called to evict tenants from a flat in London's Docklands. Opening it up, they realise they urgently need police back-up - and the property quickly becomes a crime scene. Brian and Graham head to Swindon Town FC to collect a debt, while Paul's team arrives at a property in Essex to find that they have to remove a woman and her six children.(n)

programme.title: Can't Pay? We'll Take It Away

Meanwhile, Stewart and Iain receive more than just threats from the staff and owner of a taxi business, a car dealer has to choose between paying up or losing his showroom stars, and an Indian restaurant owner is in danger of losing his livelihood.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary revisits individuals featured in previous episodes to see how they are getting on. Rob is 45 and has been on the dole for 20 years. He has lost his case for compensation against the council after an accident outside a shop, but refuses to give up and is seeking damages from the shop owner instead. The film also catches up with a family from Whitby who include a father with Tourette's and an autistic son, and single parent Matt who lives in Cowes on the Isle of Wight with his two sons.(n)

programme.title: On Benefits
programme.desc: The documentary revisits individuals featured in previous episodes to see how they have been getting on. While some have been battling eviction and family break-ups, for others things have changed for the better. From dole-claiming ex-soap stars to people who use their benefits to pay for their pets, the day-to-day reality of life on the dole is revealed.(n)

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: In the 23rd century, the world faces destruction from a seemingly unstoppable force of pure evil. Meanwhile, a New York cab driver encounters a mysterious woman destined to save the Earth from its fate, and has to protect her from a scheming arms dealer and a horde of alien mercenaries. Luc Besson's sci-fi adventure, starring Bruce Willis, Milla Jovovich and Gary Oldman.(n)

programme.title: That's My Boy
programme.desc: A teenager fathers a child and raises him alone, but when the boy grows up, he no longer wants anything to do with his drunken, irresponsible parent. As he prepares to get married, the son finds his father gatecrashing the wedding, desperate to rebuild their relationship but just as obnoxious as ever. Comedy, starring Adam Sandler and Andy Samberg.(n)

programme.title: Daredevil
programme.desc: Blinded by toxic waste as a child, Matt Murdock develops superhuman awareness and balance which enable him to tackle New York's worst villains(n)

programme.title: The 33
programme.desc: Based on a true event, the film follows the 2010 mining disaster incident where a group of thirty-three miners were trapped inside the San Jose mine in Chile for more than two months after a gold and copper mine collapses(n)

programme.title: Hoosiers
programme.desc: Hoosiers tells the true story of a group of underdogs who become champions. Set in the 1950s, Hoosiers is about a hard-luck, unemployed college basketball coach (Gene Hackman) who gets a chance to coach a small-town Indiana high-school basketball team. Facing resentment from the community and the team itself, Hackman manages to inspire his young athletes, leading them to the state championship with the help of the assistant coach (Dennis Hopper), who happens to be a recovering alcoholic(n)

programme.title: Stuck on You
programme.desc: Bob and Walt are inseparable - they're conjoined twins. But things start to come apart when Walt pursues his Hollywood dream(n)

programme.title: Bride Wars
programme.desc: The gloves come off when two best friends schedule their dream weddings for the same date, at the same place, at the same time and neither is willing to budge(n)

programme.title: Nine to Five
programme.desc: Colin Higgins' feminist comedy stars Jane Fonda, Dolly Parton and Lily Tomlin as three office workers stuck with an odious sexist pig for a boss. After her husband runs off with another woman, Judy Bernly must find work for the first time. Joining Consolidated Companies as a secretary, she is taken under the wing of super-efficient, long-time office manager Violet Newstead and fellow secretary Doralee Rhodes. The trio have the misfortune of working for Franklin Hart Jr - a first-class chauvinist, who will quite happily tip pencils on the floor just so he can ogle Rhodes' cleavage while she picks them up. When Newstead is unfairly passed over for promotion for the umpteenth time, the women head for Doralee's house to commiserate and smoke pot, which prompts revenge fantasies from each of them. But then fantasy blends with reality, and events spin out of control..(n)

programme.title: My Cousin Vinny
programme.desc: The hilarious hit comedy in which Marisa Tomei won an Oscar for her dazzling performance as Lisa, the girlfriend of Joe Pesci's loser lawyer Vinny. Unfortunately his first case just happens to involve his young cousin Ralph Macchio, who has been wrongly accused of the murder of a shop assistant. Down in Alabama for the trial, it's up to Vinny to save the day with a dynamite performance (provided that he can stay awake in court for long enough) - and hang on to Lisa as their relationship hits the rocks(n)

programme.title: Dragonfly
programme.desc: Kevin Costner gives a sensitive performance in this intriguing thriller about a doctor who tries to communicate with his dead spouse. After his wife dies while on a Red Cross mission, a man (Costner) is plagued by what he believes are messages from her, and tries to decipher what they mean. Kathy Bates, Joe Morton, Ron Rifkin, Linda Hunt, Susanna Thompson, Jacob Vargas(n)

programme.title: Simon Birch
programme.desc: Ian Michael Smith is a tiny bundle of joy as the star of this moving tale of friendship and faith. Simon Birch is a boy so small that at age 12 he plays the infant Jesus in a Christmas pageant. But Simon believes God has a special plan for him and sets out on a spiritual quest, joined by his best friend. Ashley Judd, Oliver Platt, Joseph Mazzello, Jim Carrey(n)

programme.title: Shattered Glass
programme.desc: Before Jayson Blair made headlines for his plagiarized New York Times reporting, Stephen Glass defamed the weekly current events magazine The New Republic with a series of eye-catching, entertaining, and completely fabricated stories. Now Glass' trail of lies gets the big-screen treatment in writer/director Billy Ray's Shattered Glass, featuring Hayden Christensen in the title role. The film chronicles Glass' time at the magazine in the late '90s, when his colorful coverage of a hedonistic Young Republican convention, superstar web hackers, and the circus surrounding the Bill Clinton/Monica Lewinsky scandal made him the toast of the publishing world, garnering attention from such national publications as George and Rolling Stone. Barely out of college, the eager Glass ingratiates himself with the office staff, including his mentor, managing editor Michael Kelly (Hank Azaria). But when Kelly is unceremoniously fired and replaced with editor Chuck Lane (Peter Sarsgaard), Glass' pieces come under a greater degree of scrutiny, until one in particular threatens to expose his tall tales to the rest of the world. Based in part on a Vanity Fair article by journalist Buzz Bissinger, Shattered Glass premiered at the Telluride and Toronto film festivals before its limited fall theatrical release(n)

programme.title: The Green Mile
programme.desc: A group of death row prison guards discover there's more to an unusual new inmate than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: The Aviator
programme.desc: Oscar-winning biopic charting the life of eccentric film director Howard Hughes over a 20-year period. Breaking into the film industry in 1927, he went on to achieve box-office success, romanced some of his leading ladies and used his millions in an attempt to break the airspeed record(n)

programme.title: Point Break
programme.desc: An undercover FBI agent infiltrates a group of extreme athletes who are using their specialized skills to pull off a series of complex crimes. Remake of the 1991 cult hit of the same name(n)

programme.title: Mafia!
programme.desc: Takeoff on the Godfather with the son of a mafia king taking over for his dying father(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: Basketball coach Dan Haskins recruits a team of predominantly black players to play for his team in racially segregated and football-mad Texas. They must overcome the many challenges that face them if they are to prove victorious against Division I favourites Kentucky(n)

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: An ambitious stock broker becomes the protégé of a ruthless corporate shark. Eventually the billionaire takes a financial interest in the airline company where the protégé's father has been employed for decades(n)

programme.title: Private Benjamin
programme.desc: When a pampered woman's husband dies on their wedding night, she is enticed by an ad to join the Army: the one with the condos and private rooms, but she soon finds the come-on was a bait-and-switch, and she's in the Army now(n)

programme.title: The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants 2
programme.desc: Ugly Betty's America Ferrera is one of four best friends facing summer excitement in this sweet chick flick(n)

programme.title: My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2
programme.desc: In this charming sequel to the 2002 sleeper hit, Toula's family throws an even bigger Greek wedding for her parents, who learn they never officially tied the knot. Meanwhile, she deals with a daughter who's eager to escape from her overbearing clan(n)

programme.title: Australia
programme.desc: In northern Australia at the beginning of World War II, an English aristocrat inherits a cattle station the size of Maryland. When English cattle barons plot to take her land, she reluctantly joins forces with a rough-hewn stock-man to drive 2,000 head of cattle across hundreds of miles of the country's most unforgiving land, only to still face the bombing of Darwin, Australia, by the Japanese forces that had attacked Pearl Harbor only months earlier(n)

programme.title: The Color of Money
programme.desc: Paul Newman racked up an Oscar reprising his role from "The Hustler", a pool shark who takes a hotshot under his wing(n)

programme.title: The Last Boy Scout
programme.desc: An ex-quarterback teams up with a down-on-his-luck PI whose quarry is murdered while he was supposed to be protecting her(n)

programme.title: Reign Of Fire
programme.desc: A survivalist (Christian Bale) teams up with a military man (Matthew McConaughey) to slay fire-breathing dragons in postapocalyptic 2020(n)

programme.title: National Security
programme.desc: The mismatched cops variation of the buddy comedy genre gets taken out of mothballs for this farce directed by longtime Adam Sandler collaborator Dennis Dugan. Martin Lawrence and Steve Zahn star, respectively, as Earl Montgomery, a loudmouthed police academy reject, and Hank Rafferty, a mild-mannered cop who is disgraced and dismissed from his job. Having met once before on a traffic stop, the two men are less than thrilled to be paired together as security guards. When the two men discover a complex smuggling scheme, however, they put aside their animosity to investigate the criminal scheme. They soon learn that the illegal enterprise involves a mastermind named Nash (Eric Roberts) and a new, virtually indestructible metal that's worth a fortune. Unable to persuade Hank's former police department superiors that they're onto a huge case, the two partners must devise a way to expose the sophisticated scam and bring down Nash on their own. National Security co-stars Colm Feore, Bill Duke, Timothy Busfield, and Wayne Knight(n)

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: Calleigh's car is run off the road and into a canal while she is en route back to the lab - and although she is unhurt, vital evidence is compromised, jeopardising an investigation into a rogue biker gang. Realising the entire case is at risk, Horatio and the team try to find new leads to solve it. Forensic drama, starring Emily Procter and David Caruso.(n)

programme.title: Patricia Cornwell's At Risk
programme.desc: An ambitious district attorney wants to improve her political standing by cracking a murder case that has gone unsolved for 20 years. She recruits a state police detective to take on the investigation, but he ends up uncovering another crime much closer to home. Mystery, starring Andie MacDowell, Daniel Sunjata and Annabeth Gish.(n)

programme.title: Deadly Pursuit
programme.desc: An Alaskan wilderness guide visits a friend in LA, where he meets and falls in love with a well-off city girl. She clearly feels the same because when he returns home, she decides to follow him - only to come up against his ex-girlfriend and a sinister drug operation. Romantic thriller, starring KC Clyde and Victoria Pratt.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: A Matter of Honour
programme.desc: The sleuth's holiday in Mexico is disrupted by a bizarre death involving a suave retired bullfighter, who has killed his best friend using one of the animals as a murder weapon - but is determined his spotless image and reputation will remain untarnished. Crime drama, starring Peter Falk, Ricardo Montalban, A Martinez and Pedro Armendariz Jr.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents are called to the scene of a car accident in which a petty officer was killed. They discover a bullet wound in the body, as well as another victim at the bottom of a nearby ravine - a woman who was beaten to death. Ducky conducts an autopsy and makes a discovery that sets the agents off in search of a missing infant. Meanwhile, Tony is distracted by developments in his relationship with Jeanne.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Lt Col Mann arrives to assist with inquiries into the murder of a marine - a case that becomes personal for Gibbs when he learns one of the witnesses is his ex-wife Stephanie. The team discovers the prime suspect was having an affair with the dead man's spouse, but the case is complicated by the revelation that the victim may have been selling top-secret military information. Starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While performing an autopsy for a class of military students, Ducky discovers the cadaver he is using is the body of a murder victim. In trying to identify the corpse, Gibbs and his team are set on the trail of a career criminal specialising in identity fraud. Meanwhile, Ziva has difficulty separating her personal feelings and professional judgment. Starring David McCallum and Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy Seal is shot dead while threatening to throw himself from the top of a building. An al-Qaeda operative emerges as the main suspect, but DiNozzo thinks the killer may actually be found closer to home. Elsewhere, a rumour spreads that Abby may be about to leave NCIS for good. Michael Weatherly stars.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The unit is called to examine the mysterious death of a sailor serving on a research vessel engaged in a top-secret mission. The ship proves to have been abandoned by its crew, and Ducky discovers the victim died from a highly contagious virus - putting everyone presently on board at risk. Drama, starring David McCallum, Mark Harmon, Michael Weatherly and Lauren Holly.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Sam reassumes a former identity to trace Abdul Habassa, the leader of a terrorist group in Yemen. However, things become complicated when the detective is given the task of guarding the kidnapped son of a Saudi prince, so Callen and Nate try to get Sam and the hostage to safety before Habaza becomes suspicious.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The concluding instalment of a two-part crossover with the original NCIS series sees Sebastian joining Abby Sciuto in Washington, DC to pick through the forensic evidence relating to the aircraft murders. Meanwhile, DC agent Ellie Bishop heads to New Orleans to help Pride and his team track down the chief suspect - Abby's brother Luca. Naval crime drama, guest starring Pauley Perrette.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: An immigrant petty officer dies in an apparent suicide, though Loretta finds fingermarks around the neck that suggest he was strangled before being thrown off a bridge. The team questions the victim's mother and brother, who both live locally and a link is found to a people-smuggling gang bringing migrants into the States using boats. When the team members intercept the latest arrivals, they see a familiar face. Elsewhere, the agents secretly create an online dating profile for Pride. Scott Bakula and Lucas Black star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The detectives become embroiled in a sensitive case when a seven-year-old boy accuses his foster parents of abusing him. Benson gets the child's file from his caseworker and discovers that his biological mother was a rape victim in one of her unsolved cases and could be the link to catching a serial rapist. Guest starring Julie Bowen (Modern Family), Luke Perry (Beverly Hills 90210) and Sara Gilbert (Roseanne, The Big Bang Theory).(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A teenage boy visits the precinct and confesses he has become sexually attracted to his much younger stepbrother, but Stabler and Benson are unable to act because no crime has been committed. However, his subsequent disappearance forces them to take urgent steps to catch him before he succumbs to the temptation to offend. Starring Christopher Meloni and Mariska Hargitay.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler's investigation of a robbery leads to his troubled daughter, who broke into a couple's home to use their shower. As he digs deeper into her college life he discovers she has been regularly using drugs and he becomes determined to find and arrest her dealer, and to help her he is forced to reconnect with his estranged mother. Crime drama, starring Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The body of a pregnant woman is found in a burnt-out building, triggering an investigation that leads the team to suspect a wealthy coffee trader and his son may be responsible. The case eventually goes to court, but a mistrial is declared - to the dismay of Novak, who vows to fight on regardless.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Detective Chester Lake is suspected of murdering a police officer, and Fin's investigation into his history reveals he has been working with a freelance team solving cold cases. Details emerge that Lake has kidnapped the friend of a 14-year-old girl who was raped and murdered - but the focus turns to the dead cop as more evidence is uncovered. Drama, starring Adam Beach, Ice-T and Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.desc: Adam Carolla comes to the aid of a couple whose small house needed emergency renovation on a retaining wall to prevent it sliding down a hill, and who also hoped to expand there living space with a deck - but were deceived by the contractor they hired to carry out the job.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Miami
programme.desc: The body of a celebrity is found at a party and the team discovers links with a mysterious gambling ring offering participants the chance to bet on the dates of famous people's deaths. Further investigation leads the officers to an offshore operation producing high-quality counterfeit banjoes. The forensic spin-off show's 100th episode, starring David Caruso and Emily Procter.(n)

programme.title: Two Wrongs
programme.desc: Nurse and single mother Sarah struggles to balance her work and home life, but her worst nightmare is realised when her daughter Lauren is abducted while walking home alone from school and she faces a moral dilemma if she is to save her child. Thriller, starring Gillian Zinser.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Any Old Port in a Storm
programme.desc: A vineyard owner's financial security is jeopardised when his playboy younger brother threatens to sell the family winery. He resorts to killing his sibling and rigging the death scene to look like a scuba-diving accident. However, the crumpled cop sees through the ruse and in the process reveals he is something of a wine buff himself. Detective drama, with Peter Falk, Donald Pleasence and Julie Harris.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Negative Reaction
programme.desc: A successful photographer wants to get rid of his nagging wife so he can pursue an affair with his assistant. He murders his spouse and makes it look as if she was killed by a kidnapper, and at the same time puts an ex-con in the frame. However, the dogged detective sees through his ruse and proceeds to pick the story to pieces. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, Dick Van Dyke, Don Gordon and Antoinette Bower.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Troubled Waters
programme.desc: The slovenly sleuth sets out on a pleasure cruise to Acapulco. However, one of the passengers is planning to kill his lover to stop her blackmailing him, and has arranged a cast-iron alibi. But when the crime is discovered, the captain looks to Columbo to solve the mystery. Drama, starring Peter Falk, Robert Vaughn, Dean Stockwell, Patrick Macnee and Poupee Bocar.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A US Marine, a waitress and a chef are shot dead at a diner, in what is thought to be a bungled robbery. However, when the team arrives to investigate, a previously unknown witness emerges from the eatery's freezer, claiming the killer had an unusual tattoo. The statement rings alarm bells for LaSalle, who realises the circumstances of the killings match those of his first-ever case with Pride 10 years earlier, which remained unsolved after Hurricane Katrina devastated the crime scene. Convinced their killer has struck again, he and Pride work together once again in an attempt to achieve closure once and for all. Naval crime drama, starring Lucas Black and Scott Bakula.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A string of house robberies at Christmas takes a bloody turn when one of the victims, a Navy Commander's wife, is found dead at the scene. Among the items stolen is a laptop containing sensitive data, and the team is able to track the computer to a moving car. However, when the police intercept the driver, it turns out to be none other than Dr Wade's adopted son Danny. Naval crime drama, guest starring Christoper Meyer.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A millionaire former CIA man meets a premature end when someone plants a controlled explosive in his lighter. Over the years he had built up an impressive list of enemies, so finding his killer looks like an uphill task, but as the agents start working through the potential culprits, a recovered computer file leads them to an escort service used by a wanted hitman. However, what they don't bank on is the chief suspect turning up dead.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Mac uncovers a murder on board a commercial flight from New York to Washington DC and sets up a makeshift crime lab to catch the killer. The case takes an unexpected twist with the discovery that the victim, an escaped convict with a history of drug-running, was posing as a federal air marshal to smuggle cash out of the country.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Evidence found at a murder scene links the victim to a number of high-profile figures, including police chief Brigham Sinclair and the benefactor who made Hawkes' career possible. The detectives learn the killer stole a data stick, but find their inquiries hindered by a private investigator trying to suppress sensitive information about his employer. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes and Mykelti Williamson.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler and Benson investigate the death of an astronaut whose body is discovered in the Hudson River. They identify two chief suspects - a drug addict who used the murdered woman's credit card and a man who was barred from the space programme after fighting with the victim. However, a shooting at the precinct jeopardises the detectives' chances of solving the case. Crime drama, guest starring James Brolin, with Christopher Meloni, Mariska Hargitay and Dann Florek.(n)

programme.title: The Sixth Sense
programme.desc: (1999) M Night Shyamalan's chiller about a boy who has the not-entirely-welcome ability to directly contact the dead. Bruce Willis stars as child psychologist Dr Malcolm Crowe, who is asked to help Cole Sear (Haley Joel Osment), who claims he can 'see dead people'. Crowe is sceptical at first, but - prompted partly by a past case he felt he badly let down - he's gradually convinced that the boy is telling the truth. Crowe believes that actively engaging with the ghostly presences could help both Sear and the spirits to find peace. Overcoming his terror, the lad finds that communicating with the deceased does, at first, seem to be beneficial. But then matters take on their own momentum, leading to one of the director's trademark plot twists... Also starring Toni Collette. M,W,S,(n)

programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia(n)

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: In the next installment of the "Maze Runner" franchise Thomas (Dylan O'Brien), Teresa (Kaya Scodelario) and the rest of the Gladers search for clues about WCKD, a powerful organization in the Scorch, a bleak landscape that is filled with dangerous obstacles. The Gladers partner with resistance fighters to take on WCKD in an attempt to discover their plans for the future in this young-adult dystopian thriller from 20th Century Fox. Directed by Wes Ball who previously directed the original film, The Maze Runner. Cast includes Thomas Brodie-Sangster, Giancarlo Esposito, Aidan Gillen, Ki Hong Lee, Barry Pepper, Lili Taylor and Patricia Clarkson(n)

programme.title: Scott Pilgrim vs. the World
programme.desc: (2010) Michael Cera (Juno, Superbad) stars in this unconventionally structured, inventive and comic paean to the alternate universe of manga and computer gaming. The movie is based on an acclaimed series of graphic novels by Canadian cartoonist Bryan Lee O'Malley, and is directed by British film-maker Edgar Wright (Shaun of the Dead, Channel 4's TV series Spaced), here making his Hollywood debut. Computer game fanatic Scott Pilgrim (Cera) is the bass player with Toronto band Sex Bob-omb. He shares his flat with his slightly-out-of-control gay friend Wallace Wells (Kieran Culkin), and courts a little controversy by dating 17-year-old schoolgirl Knives Chau (Ellen Wong). However, theirs is a fairly platonic relationship, and one he's prepared to ditch the moment he sets eyes on the woman (literally) of his dreams: Ramona Flowers (Mary Elizabeth Winstead). But if Scott wants to capture the impossibly cool New Yorker's heart, he must first defeat her former lovers, the Seven Evil Exes, in video game end-level-style combat. So he embarks on a kinetic, romantic quest, largely conducted within his own head, replete with slapstick violence, impressive effects and witty retorts(n)

programme.title: Puerto Ricans in Paris
programme.desc: Two Puerto Rican NYC cops (Luis Guzman and Edgar Garcia) are asked by a pair of French fashion designers (Alice Taglioni and Frederic Anscombre) to come to Paris to hunt down the counterfeiters who stole a couture handbag. Rosie Perez and Rosario Dawson co-star. Directed by Ian Edelman(n)

programme.title: Species
programme.desc: Sci-fi horror about a half-human, half-alien female mutant who escapes from a government laboratory and attempts to prolong the life of her species by mating with a human. Pursued by scientists and police, she passes through a chrysalid stage and takes on the appearance of a beautiful young woman. But she can also metamorphose from her eye-catching form into a repulsive, death-dealing monster(n)

programme.title: Species II
programme.desc: Sequel to the sci-fi blockbuster. After becoming the first person on Mars, astronaut Patrick Ross is infected with spores of alien DNA, resulting in a dangerously inflamed libido and an outbreak of alien offspring. Elsewhere, the monster who wreaked havoc in the original film has been cloned and united with government assassins in order to track down Ross and eliminate the new species(n)

programme.title: Undercover Brother

programme.desc: The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. The Rhea-M comet starts revolving round earth and provokes all machinery to become their own masters and revolt against mankind. When Anwar disappears on his way home from a conference in South Africa, she is driven frantic trying to find proof of his whereabouts in the face of official denial. Anwar is being held as a suspected terrorist in secrecy in Marrakech, where CIA operative Douglas Freeman is reluctantly involved in his torture. Meanwhile, one of the torturer's daughters, Fatima, is secretly in love with a fellow student who may be following extreme paths. As Hood brings the strands together, the various characters' actions intertwine, moving towards a dramatic conclusion(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Nine - Morning Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the morning session on day nine at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, including the men's and women's 4x100m and 4x400m heats. The Jamaicans won three of the four relays in 2015, with only USA's men's 4x400m triumph preventing a clean sweep, and the likes of Elaine Thompson and Usain Bolt may be rested in the 4x100m, where the champions boast significant strength in depth. The decathlon also continues with the 110m hurdles, discus and pole vault. Coverage continues on BBC2.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Nine - Evening Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the ninth and penultimate evening at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, where Mo Farah and Usain Bolt are set to make their final track appearances in the 5,000m and 4x100m finals respectively, hoping to add another gold each to their incredible medal tallies. The decathlon also concludes with the javelin and 1500m, and finals take place in the women's high jump, 100m hurdles and 4x100m, and men's javelin. With commentary by Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter and Steve Backley, and analysis from Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the opening round of Premier League fixtures, including Watford v Liverpool, Chelsea v Burnley and Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester City. Meanwhile, Chelsea will have expected to get their title-defence off to a winning start and newly promoted Brighton faced a difficult task against Pep Guardiola's expensively assembled side.(n)

Discovering his cell phone has been left in the box with him, he uses this fragile link to the outside world to try to get help - but his supply of air is running low and even he does not know where he is. Thriller, starring Ryan Reynolds.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents action from the opening round of Premier League fixtures, including Watford v Liverpool, Chelsea v Burnley and Brighton & Hove Albion v Manchester City. Liverpool defeated the Hornets 1-0 in last season's corresponding fixture thanks to Emre Can's Match of the Day Goal of the Season-winner and will have expected another tough encounter. Meanwhile, Chelsea will have expected to get their title-defence off to a winning start and newly promoted Brighton faced a difficult task against Pep Guardiola's expensively assembled side.(n)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break.(n)

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher and Emma Barnett present topical debate covering religious, moral and ethical issues, with guest panellists and contributions from viewers.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander, Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin explore properties about to be auctioned in Catford, London, in Liverpool, near the river Mersey, and in Alvaston, Derby.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Extended edition in which a red team of singers and a blue team of multi-instrumentalists join experts Catherine Southon and Paul Laidlaw at an antiques fair in Edinburgh, followed by an auction in Glasgow, where Anita Manning has her gavel in hand. Meanwhile, Presenter Tim Wonnacott heads to Plympton in Devon to visit Saltram House.(n)

programme.title: Wanted Down Under
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps Lisa Hoffman and her husband Math decide whether to move to Australia by showing them a selection of properties in Brisbane. Lisa believes she can enjoy a more adventurous life in the city and Math is impressed by the homes that are within their budget, but he is doubtful that he will be able to leave his friends and family in Wales behind.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Continent
programme.desc: Anita Rani goes house-hunting with a buyer from Hertfordshire who is seeking a retreat for himself and paying guests in the southern Spanish province of Almeria. Along the way, Anita gives advice on the practicalities of moving to Spain, and takes to the water at a Roman baths.(n)

programme.title: Flog It
programme.desc: People are invited to try to make money out of their antiques by taking a risk at auction.(n)

programme.title: Super Small Animals
programme.desc: Patrick Aryee investigates the world of miniature creatures, from a primate no bigger than a mouse to a chameleon that can fit on a human fingertip, finding out what makes them some of the most successful animals on the planet. He reveals how the smallest armadillo manages to control its temperature in the searing desert sun, and meets a scientist who studies how really tiny spiders have a surprising trick that enables them to travel an incredible 40 miles a day using almost no energy.(n)

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Josie D'Arby attends the New Wine gathering in Somerset, and Connie Fisher visits Abbey Road studios to celebrate the 50th anniversary of the Beatles recording All You Need Is Love.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Anita Rani and Sean Fletcher present an episode exploring Dartmoor. Anita takes a trip along a trail that connects local artists and crafts people, meeting a blacksmith and learning to spin wool using traditional methods, while Sean investigates how unwanted Dartmoor pony foals that would normally be culled at birth can instead be used in therapy for people with learning difficulties.(n)

programme.title: Fake or Fortune
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and art expert Philip Mould investigate a portrait of a man wearing a black cravat painted in 1939, which the owner believes is an early work of Lucian Freud, from his time at the Central School of Art - even though Freud himself denied painting it. The team tries to uncover who the mysterious man in the painting was, whether it really was painted by Freud, and if so, why did he claim that it was not his work. The investigation digs up a complex history of feuds, rivalry and intrigue.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further coverage of the 10th and concluding evening at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, featuring the finals of four more events. Asbel Kibrop and Caster Semenya will be among the favourites in the respective men's 1500m and women's 800m finals, before attention switches to the men's and women's 4x400m relays, both of which Great Britain will be hopeful of winning medals in should they be involved. With commentary by Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter and Steve Backley, and analysis from Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents action from this afternoon's fixtures - Newcastle United v Tottenham Hotspur at St James' Park and Manchester United v West Ham United at Old Trafford. Newly promoted Newcastle faced a difficult task against last term's runners-up. Meanwhile the Red Devils, will have expected to get off to a winning start against the Hammers after another summer of heavy investment, though Slaven Bilic has also strengthened his side considerably.(n)

programme.title: Brendan Foster: A Life in Athletics
programme.desc: An insight into the career of the broadcaster and former athlete, who won gold as a long distance runner at the European Championships and Commonwealth Games in the 1970s, before going on to become a commentator. Foster has covered nine Olympic Games during his time with the BBC, and is due to retire following the IAAF World Championships, which begin on Friday.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Escapade in Japan
programme.desc: A six-year-old American is found by a fisherman's son after a plane crash in Japan. The youngsters believe that for some reason they are in trouble with the police and they try to lose themselves in the teeming streets of Kyoto, unaware that both their families are frantically searching for them. Children's adventure, starring Jon Provost, Roger Nakagawa,Teresa Wright and Cameron Mitchell,.(n)

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: Four sisters find maturity and romance during the American Civil War, as they face tragedy and heartache, drawing love and support from one another. Oscar-winning drama based on Louisa May Alcott's classic novel, starring June Allyson, Peter Lawford, Margaret O'Brien, Elizabeth Taylor, Mary Astor and Janet Leigh.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Woodsman and TV personality Ray Mears joins guest host Ching He Huang to sample dishes prepared in the kitchen by chefs Paul Ainsworth and Tommy Banks.(n)

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Sat Bains joins Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen to chat about the future of food and demonstrate his take on a traditional bread and butter pudding, using cutting-edge culinary equipment to create a modern twist on this classic dish. Drinks expert Kate Goodman picks dessert wines to provide the ideal accompaniment, while food writer Stefan Gates examines the pros and cons of meat that has been grown in a laboratory.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day Nine - Morning Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents further coverage of the opening session on day nine at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, featuring the conclusion of the men's 4x400m heats. Coverage continues on the interactive service.(n)

programme.title: Nigel and Adam's Farm Kitchen
programme.desc: Culinary writer Nigel Slater and Countryfile presenter Adam Henson follow the journey of more fresh food from farm to fork. They focus on chicken, the UK's favourite meat, which appears on almost every restaurant and takeaway menu in the country. Nigel visits eateries in Manchester for inspiration on spicing up his recipes back in the kitchen at the Cotswolds farm, before demonstrating a few alternatives to shoppers' favourites such as chicken Kievs and avocado dips. Meanwhile, Adam accepts the ultimate farming challenge - to grow exotic crops like rice and Asian mushrooms for a selection of international dishes.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A look at the TV appearances made over the years by American Oscar-winning actor James Stewart, capturing the milestones and highlights of his life and career, which led to him being considered a Hollywood icon. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: The Philadelphia Story
programme.desc: A wealthy socialite prepares to marry an influential businessman and politician. However, her plans for the big day are disrupted by the attendance of her irresponsible ex-husband and a cynical tabloid reporter looking for a big story. Romantic comedy based on Philip Barry's stage play, starring Katharine Hepburn, Cary Grant and James Stewart.(n)

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: A team of reptile lovers take on three background actors in the quiz testing general knowledge and lateral thinking. The players must make connections between four things that may at first not appear to be linked, with one set of clues consisting of bubble, indemnity, Dutch and entendre. Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots, while Adam Frost uncovers the secrets of successful planting combinations in an Oxfordshire garden. Carol Klein chooses varieties of late flowering clematis as her plant of the month, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens and is now threatening rare and native plants, and Mark Lane joins the enthusiasts who have lovingly restored a walled garden in Warwick. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: The Sweet Makers
programme.sub-title: The Sweet Makers: A Georgian Treat.
programme.desc: Four modern confectioners use original recipes, equipment and ingredients to recreate the extravagant displays of a Georgian confectionery shop. Guided by food historian Dr Annie Gray and social historian Emma Dabiri, the foursome travel to Bath to experience first-hand the life of confectioners in late 18th and early 19th-century England. The sweet-makers craft everything from towering jellies made from boiled calves feet, glasses of Parmesan ice cream, and a final course featuring an edible landscape.(n)

programme.title: Iolo's Great Welsh Parks
programme.desc: New series. Naturalist Iolo Williams returns to explore more historic estates and parklands. He begins at Great Orme Country Park in Llandudno, which is full of history and ancient mines, and thousands of people visit the limestone headland every year for its views of the north Wales coast. Iolo also meets local wildlife experts to learn about the area's rare moths and butterflies, ferocious stoats and migrating birds.(n)

programme.title: Proms Extra
programme.desc: As the Proms season crosses its halfway point, Katie Derham turns her attention to the National Youth Orchestra of Great Britain, which performed Thomas Ades' Polaris as part of Prom 28 last weekend. She also revisits yesterday's Prom 35, in which conductor John Wilson led his own ensemble in a rendition of Oklahoma!, by Oscar Hammerstein II and Richard Rodgers. Plus, David Owen Norris returns with Chord of the Week.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: Captain Mainwaring is determined that all his men should be well-shod and have battle-worthy feet, so he starts a foot-hardening regimen involving lengthy route marches - which start to take a toll on the men after a few days. Comedy first broadcast in 1970, starring Arthur Lowe, John Le Mesurier, Clive Dunn and Ian Lavender.(n)

programme.title: Alice in Wonderland
programme.desc: A 19-year-old Alice returns to the magical land, having forgotten her previous adventures. She finds the tyrannical Red Queen has begun a reign of terror that can only be ended by slaying the monstrous Jabberwocky - a task she is seemingly destined to attempt. Tim Burton's fantasy adventure based on Lewis Carroll's novels, starring Mia Wasikowska, Johnny Depp, Helena Bonham Carter and Anne Hathaway.(n)

programme.title: Performance Live
programme.sub-title: Performance Live - Flood: To the Sea.
programme.desc: A chance to see a performance of the ground-breaking drama To the Sea, the third instalment of James Phillips' epic four-part multimedia narrative Flood, which explores what might happen if England was destroyed by a global flood. Serving as a post-apocalyptic re-imagining of the flood myth found in Judeo-Christian scripture, the first part of Phillips' tale took the form of a short online film in which an enigmatic girl is dragged - still living - from deep beneath the waves by a North Sea fisherman. The second part, Abundance, was presented as a live open-air play at Victoria Dock in Hull earlier this year, and tonight's third installment asks a simple question: what if the masses of refugees, frequently seen on news broadcasts fleeing scenes of devastation, had English accents?.(n)

programme.title: Golf: USPGA Championship
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents live coverage of the closing stages of day three at the fourth and final Major of the year, held at Quail Hollow Club in Charlotte, North Carolina. Commentary from Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Maureen Madill and Mark James. Live coverage begins on the interactive service at 7.00pm.(n)

programme.title: The Way
programme.desc: A doctor travels to France to retrieve the body of his son, who died retracing the journey of a historical pilgrimage through the Pyrenees. He decides that he will complete the trek in his son's honour, and acquires a number of travelling companions all looking for meaning in their lives. Comedy drama based on the book by Jack Hitt, starring Martin Sheen, Deborah Kara Unger, James Nesbitt and Emilio Estevez, who also directed.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: A to Z of TV Gardening
programme.desc: Carol Kirkwood looks back on her alphabetical journey through the world of horticulture, picking out her favourite tips from fellow presenters. The series progressed in order from A to Z, featuring gardening themes beginning with all 26 letters.(n)

programme.title: The Instant Gardener
programme.desc: Presenter Helen Skelton and expert garden designer Danny Clarke transform a tiny back yard into a beach garden inspired by the neighbouring Barry coastline.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don gives advice on how to cut and maintain hedges as well as ideas on growing fruit in pots, while Adam Frost uncovers the secrets of successful planting combinations in an Oxfordshire garden. Carol Klein chooses varieties of late flowering clematis as her plant of the month, Nick Bailey travels to the southern tip of Cornwall to seek out a plant which escaped from our gardens and is now threatening rare and native plants, and Mark Lane joins the enthusiasts who have lovingly restored a walled garden in Warwick. Including Weather.(n)

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Ellie Harrison investigates the role flowers and plants play in everyday life. She visits a herb garden in Bristol to find out about a common plant that is useful in treating cancer, meets a dye maker who only uses natural plant and flower-based colours, discovers a special kind of pickling, and joins a class of schoolchildren who are cultivating rare orchids.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents highlights of the series, recalling his favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Nadiya's British Food Adventure
programme.desc: Nadiya Hussain samples what London has to offer, heading to Beckton in the east of the city to visit an indoor urban farm in an industrial estate that uses hydroponics and aquaponics to rear fish and grow vegetables. She then heads north to Holloway, to meet chef Pratap Chatal, who runs supper clubs in his home where he showcases his revolutionary idea of cooking his food with fragrances.(n)

programme.title: Lorraine's Fast, Fresh and Easy Food
programme.desc: Lorraine Pascale demonstrates simple dishes completely from scratch, ideal for today's hectic world where, for many, packet and microwave meals have become the norm. She has solutions for all occasions, beginning with ideas for easy entertaining when friends or family turn up out of the blue and reveals how it is possible to spend less time in the kitchen and more time having fun with everyone else.(n)

programme.title: MOTD2 Extra
programme.desc: Mark Chapman and guests review yesterday's Premier League fixtures and look ahead to Newcastle United v Tottenham Hotspur and Manchester United v West Ham United.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of day 10 at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, featuring the men's 20km walk. Great Britain's Tom Bosworth will be hoping to contend here, having recently broken the mile walk world record at the Anniversary Games. Live coverage begins on the interactive service at 7.40am.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Ancient Capital: Secrets of Orkney
programme.desc: Andy Torbet and local seafaring volunteers build a boat made of just willow and cow hide, and set out to cross the dangerous Pentland Firth as the ancient Orcadians would have done. Neil Oliver investigates the extraordinary discovery of some human bones, Chris Packham goes in search of whales and Shini Somara uncovers the powers of the tides.(n)

programme.title: Steve Backshall's Extreme Mountain Challenge
programme.desc: Part two of two. The naturalist reaches the peak of one of Venezuela's tepui mountains, before joining a party of Italian cavers as they venture into the unexplored caverns within. Inside, they discover strange wildlife and evidence of the geological forces that give the tepuis their unusual shape. Finally, the team returns to the ground by abseiling down the Angel Falls, the world's highest waterfall.(n)

programme.title: Live Athletics: World Championships
programme.sub-title: World Athletics Championships 2017: Day 10 - Evening Session.
programme.desc: Gabby Logan presents coverage of the 10th and concluding evening at The London Stadium in Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park. Great Britain's Robbie Grabarz and Laura Muir will hope to be involved in the respective high jump and 5,000m finals, and medals are also decided in the women's discus. With commentary by Steve Cram, Brendan Foster, Andrew Cotter and Steve Backley, and analysis from Michael Johnson, Denise Lewis and Colin Jackson. Coverage continues on BBC1.(n)

programme.title: Secrets of Silicon Valley
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jamie Bartlett investigates the impact of technology on democracy, revealing how aspects of social media designed to benefit the advertising industry by gathering personal data about users can be used to influence voters and spread misinformation. Featuring contributions from a key insider on Donald Trump's presidential campaign.(n)

programme.title: This World
programme.sub-title: North Korea: Murder in the Family.
programme.desc: Documentary examining the murder of the North Korean dictator's half-brother Kim Jong-nam at Kuala Lumpur airport. The programme examines the activities of North Korean secret agents at the airport on the day of the killing, and reports on a powerful international business network that has allowed the Kim dynasty to remain in power for nearly 70 years.(n)

programme.title: Golf: USPGA Championship
programme.desc: Eilidh Barbour presents live coverage of the closing stages of the fourth and concluding day at the fourth and final Major of the year, held at Quail Hollow Club in Charlotte, North Carolina. Commentary from Peter Alliss, Ken Brown, Maureen Madill and Mark James. Live coverage begins on the interactive service at 7.00pm.(n)

programme.title: The Brain with David Eagleman
programme.desc: Neuroscientist David Eagleman takes viewers on a journey into the inner workings of the human brain, revealing how it affects thoughts, actions and beliefs.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Treasure Islands
programme.desc: The final leg of this exploration of the UK's Overseas Territories begins in the Caribbean, where Stewart McPherson finds some unexpected wildlife. In the centre of the Atlantic, on Ascension Island, he surveys an extinct volcano. Stewart also visits the Sovereign Base Areas on Cyprus, along with Gibraltar, the present home of Barbary Macaques, Europe's only wild colony of monkeys. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: Giralt questions his new prime suspect Heredia about Ana's disappearance, and things begin to look worse for him when a body is found dumped near his summer house. In Spanish.(n)

programme.title: I Know Who You Are
programme.desc: The truth is revealed, as the events surrounding Ana's disappearance are played out in full. Thriller, starring Francesc Garrido. In Spanish. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Mike Read and Steve Wright host the May 3 show, featuring Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark, Blancmange, New Order, Kenny Loggins, Jocelyn Brown, the Human League and Duran Duran.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: An edition from May 10, 1984, in which David Jensen and John Peel introduce performances by Belle and the Devotions, Queen, Bob Marley and the Wailers, Terri Wells, the Pointer Sisters and Duran Duran.(n)

programme.title: How Quizzing Got Cool: TV's Brains of Britain
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell, Judith Keppel, Chris Tarrant, Mark Labbett and Nicholas Parsons help Ben Miller trace the origins of the pro-quizzers; quiz show veterans who have emerged from the crowd of quiz aficionados in recent years to achieve fame and fortune for their general knowledge prowess.(n)

programme.title: How to Make a Number One Record
programme.desc: Documentary studying what it takes to propel a single to number one. Featuring a look at those who have succeeded in topping the charts, and the effect it had on their lives, alongside an examination of the roles played by art, science, chance and manipulation in reaching the pinnacle of pop.(n)

programme.title: Britain's Treasure Islands
programme.desc: The final leg of this exploration of the UK's Overseas Territories begins in the Caribbean, where Stewart McPherson finds some unexpected wildlife. In the centre of the Atlantic, on Ascension Island, he surveys an extinct volcano. Stewart also visits the Sovereign Base Areas on Cyprus, along with Gibraltar, the present home of Barbary Macaques, Europe's only wild colony of monkeys. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: BBC Proms 2017
programme.desc: Petroc Trelawny introduces a concert of pieces by Rachmaninov, performed by the BBC Scottish Symphony Orchestra, conducted by Thomas Dausgaard and joined by the Latvian Radio Choir. The performance features the composers Second Symphony and Third Piano Concerto, with soloist Alexander Gavrylyuk.(n)

programme.title: John Denver at Wembley Arena
programme.desc: A classic performance by the US musician at London's Wembley Arena in 1979, originally shown as part of a selection of programmes to mark the 70th year since the birth of the quintessential `country boy'.(n)

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: Chris Lintott and Maggie Aderin-Pocock keep an eye out for the Perseids meteor shower, and investigate the cosmic debris that falls to Earth from space.(n)

programme.title: Black Roses: The Killing of Sophie Lancaster
programme.desc: The story of the 20-year-old's death, told through poems written by Simon Armitage and an interview with her mother Sylvia. Sophie recalls her childhood, school life and the events leading up to her murder by a group of youths while she protected her boyfriend from a violent attack. Documentary drama, starring Rachel Austin.(n)

programme.title: Return to Betjemanland
programme.desc: Documentary focusing on the life and work of John Betjeman, the writer and broadcaster who was Poet Laureate from 1972 until his death in 1984. Betjeman's biographer, AN Wilson, visits places of significance to the poet, travelling through `Betjemanland' - which consists of areas in London, Oxford, Cornwall, Somerset and Berkshire. In doing so, the presenter paints a portrait of his subject's complexity, and reveals how he adopted a somewhat contradictory approach to social class and religion.(n)

programme.title: The Big Match Revisited
programme.desc: A look back at some classic editions of The Big Match. This episode, from December 10th 1976, features Liverpool v QPR, Chelsea v Wolves and Leeds v Aston Villa.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: A couple are taking in the view from a cliff top when a car driven by an already bleeding man crashes into theirs and teeters on the brink before plunging over the precipice. Callen and the team are brought in to investigate when the driver is identified as Lieutenant Brian Roth, and they discover that the car is registered to a Hollywood socialite Aubrey Darva. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Eric pulls the team together when he finds a video of kidnapped agent Dominic Vail posted on a jihadist website, with the terrorists holding him stating that he will be executed within 24 hours unless a comrade of theirs being held by the US government is released. One of the captors is identified as a being an associate of Sam, and his involvement also seems to indicate Dom is being held in Sudan. Crime drama, starring LL Cool J.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: An attack on a private plane immediately after it lands turns out to be the hijack of the secret army transfer of terrorist leader Ala A Din Keshwar, the man whose release was demanded in exchange for Dom's life. Callen and the rest of the NCIS team vow to get their hands on Keshwar before he can flee the country. Meanwhile, Hetty offers her resignation to Vance following Dom's death.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Callen's cover is blown while he is working undercover and he sends a coded text to Hetty, who effectively cuts him off from NCIS as she makes it the team's top priority to discover who found out his real identity and how. A man called Eugene Keelson contacts Callen and threatens to reveal information about his past unless he runs an errand for him, which involves delivering a flash drive to Bulgarian gang. Crime drama, starring Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: NCIS: Los Angeles
programme.desc: Keelson is found to have had a huge file labelled `Callen, G', but it is destroyed remotely before Callen can retrieve it. The team is assigned to monitor Iranian terrorists trying to get their hands on a huge hidden fortune that belonged to the former shah, and the case appears to have a concrete link to Callen when a woman in the group's ranks is identified as being his sister Amy. Starring Chris O'Donnell.(n)

programme.title: Dr Quinn: Medicine Woman
programme.desc: Two of Dr Mike's patients die suddenly of an unknown cause, and fearing a deadly and mysterious disease is haunting her clinic, the medic feels compelled to burn everything in the facility to kill off any residual infection. programme.title: The Gambler, the Girl and the Gunslinger
programme.desc: A ranch owner loses half his home in a poker game, meaning he now has to share the property with his rival gambler. Comedy Western, starring Dean Cain, James Tupper and Allison Hossack.(n)

programme.title: The High Chaparral
programme.desc: Blue decides to leave the ranch and pursue an artistic career.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A serial killer begins posting footage of his crimes online - and as the agents investigate, they realise that each film contains visual clues to the identity of the next victim. In a further bizarre twist, Abby later finds what seems to be a new video on her computer - and the case takes on fresh urgency with the discovery that it is actually a live feed, suggesting the murderer is somewhere on the premises.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bank at Quantico is robbed and a security guard killed, but the team soon discovers that stealing money may not have been the perpetrators' primary objective. Meanwhile, Gibbs is given the task of evaluating an inexperienced new agent assigned by Vance to help investigate the case. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rey Valentin.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs sends DiNozzo and Ziva to retrieve top-secret information from a secure military base - a mission aimed at catching a mole in the NCIS ranks. Unfortunately, it soon becomes clear that the traitor is still at large - so the building is locked down and all agents are rounded up in a final effort to catch the culprit. Guest starring Jude Ciccolella.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Having identified the mole in their ranks, the agents arrest the traitor's contact Ted Bankston, a former NSA agent working for a kidnapper code-named the Weatherman - who is making millions on the stock markets out of stolen military data. Drama, guest-starring David Eigenberg, with Mark Harmon, David McCallum and Cote de Pablo.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A petty officer is killed in what initially seems to be a road-rage incident - until investigations reveal evidence of foul play. Digging deeper, the team finds the dead man belonged to an underground fight club, and sets about discovering whether his involvement was a factor in the case. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly.(n)

programme.title: Ultimate Force
programme.desc: A ship with a suspicious crew docks at Southampton, so Henno and Jamie sneak aboard to plant a tracking device. Unfortunately, the operation falters and they are forced to kill a man - leading to a ferocious gun battle that leaves Red Troop in danger. Starring Ross Kemp, Jamie Draven and Alex Reid.(n)

programme.title: Ultimate Force
programme.desc: Tough new commander Captain Ian Macalwain takes over from Dotsy, and immediately antagonises the men by expecting them to salute and call him `sir'. Dempsey pressures Jamie to uphold the regiment's honour at an official inquiry into the gun battle aboard the Dowager Joan, while Henno is shocked to discover how Caroline really sustained her injuries. Drama, starring Ross Kemp and Jamie Draven.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Trivette infiltrates the gang of a career criminal who is out on parole and back to his old ways, and Alex opens her rehabilitation centre to help steer youngsters away from crime.(n)

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: An escaped convict goes on a killing spree, seeking revenge against those who put him away. Walker and Trivette race to stop him before he murders the trial judge who sentenced him.(n)

programme.desc: US Navy captain Jake Marsden is murdered in his hotel room and inquiries lead to marine lieutenant Emma Reynolds - who tells the team she was the intended target. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team investigates the death of a Navy commander last seen in the company of a mysterious blonde woman, who turns out to be missing NCIS agent and Tony's ex-lover EJ Barrett. She identifies the murderer as Seal-turned-assassin Marcellus Dane, who is suspected of working for Casey Stratton - a member of black ops unit Phantom Eight. Guest starring Sarah Jane Morris.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: An estate agent and two clients discover the body of Lt Com Maya Burris, a naval attache who had been working in Egypt, and her detective husband Nick arrives on the scene to demand answers. Using documents discovered on the victim's boat, Abby links her to Barry Norton, who is suspected of having sold government secrets to a Middle Eastern terrorist group known as the SRC.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: Gibbs goes into his favourite diner for a cup of coffee and finds himself staring down the barrel of a gun, forcing him to question choices he has made in the past and present. The action then flashes back a few days to when he and the rest of the team members were investigating the death of a petty officer on board USS Gentry, which has been undergoing repairs in dry dock. The 200th episode of the crime drama, starring Mark Harmon.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy captain wearing a colourful costume underneath his uniform is shot and killed in a flower shop, and further investigation reveals he was leading a double life as a masked vigilante. Vance brings in Tony's ex-fiancee, journalist Wendy Miller, who claims the victim had been trying to expose a scandal, and as the team pursues the case, a real-estate scam is uncovered. Guest starring Perrey Reeves (Entourage).(n)

programme.desc: Tori Herridge and Alex Langlands investigate Merseyside's coastal archaeology. They also discover a story from Liverpool that echoes the plot of classic Ealing comedy Whisky Galore!.(n)

programme.title: Paul O'Grady's Hollywood
programme.desc: The TV presenter continues his comprehensive exploration of the bombastic side of Hollywood, this time turning his attention to musical numbers that have elevated the popularity of their respective films. Over the years, Tinseltown musicals have touched on a wide variety of cinematic genres, from the family-friendly fantasies to urban dance and even more macabre territory via The Rocky Horror Picture Show. Here, Paul revisits Mary Poppins' tongue-twisting Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious, Pinball Wizard from Tommy, and a variety of numbers from Fame and Flashdance. He also sheds light on how Disney animation studios are keeping the musical genre alive, with blockbuster hits such as Frozen, which came complete with its own Oscar-winning girl-power anthem Let It Go. Includes contributions by Jonathan Ross, Celine Dion, Maureen Lipman and more. The concluding part can be seen on More4 tomorrow at 9pm.(n)

programme.title: Red 2
