programme.desc: Death grants Peter his wish to go back in time to 1984, but only for one night. Breaking a date with Lois, he decides to socialise with a famous film star. On his return to the present, he discovers his changes to the timeline have had shocking repercussions.(n)

programme.title: American Dad
programme.desc: Roger's one-night stand with a fellow alien he and Francine find in the woods develops into a full-blown relationship. However, he soon gets tired of his new girlfriend's quirks - and tries to get rid of her by calling the CIA. With the voice of Kim Kardashian.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.sub-title: What You Don't Know Can Kill You.
programme.desc: Jessica agrees to help a friend's niece prove that her fiance's death on his motorcycle was not an accident as had been supposed. Whodunit, starring Angela Lansbury.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica Fletcher tackles a mystery involving a diamond, a dog and an old grudge while on holiday at a friend's lodge in the Grand Teton mountains. A surly visitor who threatened to reveal some scandalous information about her friend is found dead. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica is called in to investigate the case of a deputy sheriff accused of murdering a businessman against whom he held a grudge - and soon finds there is more to it than meets the eye. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Climb the Greasy Pole - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. A seat becomes vacant on the local council when Sam Popham is taken ill, so Pop stands in the election, and Mariette returns from holiday with Charley. David Jason stars.(n)

programme.title: Columbo: Butterfly in Shades of Grey
programme.desc: A radio presenter is plotting to sabotage his adopted daughter's plans to publish her first novel and kills one of his employees for trying to help her. He thinks he has the perfect alibi, claiming that the victim was murdered while they were talking to each other on the phone, and there is a tape recording to prove it - but his ruse fails to fool the dishevelled detective. Crime drama, with Peter Falk, William Shatner and Molly Hagan.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Cruising
programme.desc: The captain of a cruise ship bound for the Mediterranean is less than impressed when five of his regular shipmates are replaced at the last minute. Despite their best efforts to earn his respect and an eagerness to please, the new recruits seem doomed to cause chaos whatever they do. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Liz Fraser and Kenneth Connor.(n)

programme.title: Carry On Cruising
programme.desc: The captain of a cruise ship bound for the Mediterranean is less than impressed when five of his regular shipmates are replaced at the last minute. Despite their best efforts to earn his respect and an eagerness to please, the new recruits seem doomed to cause chaos whatever they do. Comedy, starring Sid James, Kenneth Williams, Liz Fraser and Kenneth Connor.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: The detective applies his professional know-how to a fatal shooting, and soon begins to suspect that the dead man's brother-in-law may know more about the case than he is letting on - a theory borne out by forensic tests on the murder weapon. Jack Shepherd stars as the dour detective, with Helen Masters and Jimmy Yuill.(n)

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: An American female bishop visiting St Gerard's College is found dead after drinking poisoned wine, and when another two killings occur, both mirroring macabre murders from Jacobean revenge tragedy, it appears the culprit is targeting candidates in the election to become vice-regent. However, when Innocent learns one of the suspects is hiding a dark secret, Lewis and Hathaway realise the motive is much more twisted. Guest starring Sian Phillips and Ronald Pickup, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox.(n)

programme.title: Housewife, 49
programme.desc: Bafta-winning drama based on a true story, written by and starring Victoria Wood. Downtrodden wife and mother Nella's life takes an unexpected turn for the better after she joins the Women's Voluntary Service office in Barrow-in-Furness during the Second World War. However, her new-found happiness is shattered when her son Cliff leaves to join the troops - provoking a painful confrontation with husband Will. David Threlfall and Stephanie Cole co-star.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: As the sole witness to a dying man's last words, Bobby Attfield is determined to solve the riddle they present, and forms an unlikely alliance with socialite Frankie Derwent and visiting family friend Miss Marple to help him on his quest. A trail of clues leads them to Castle Savage, where they uncover a hotbed of stifled emotion, treachery and deceit among its strange inhabitants. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast that includes Sean Biggerstaff, Samantha Bond, Richard Briers, Rafe Spall, Warren Clarke, Mark Williams, Georgia Moffett, Helen Lederer and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: Foyle's War
programme.desc: When an unpopular employee at a military psychiatric hospital is found murdered, there is no shortage of suspects, but a colleague of the man, an exiled Polish Jew, holds himself responsible for the death. Foyle is convinced there is another explanation, but his priorities shift when news of a missing boy from London reaches Hastings. Starring Michael Kitchen, Phyllida Law and Nicholas Woodeson.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: While investigating the murder of prison officer Charlie Tyner, Brooks and Devlin discover he had been abusing his position and convicts in his charge. A suspect is brought to trial, but Steel and Phillips go in pursuit of a career criminal connected to Tyner and have to persuade their key witness to give evidence against a man she claims to love. Starring Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber, Ben Daniels and Freema Agyeman.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: The withdrawal of a library book on the day of his death is the only clue to a student's murder. Two people who can be linked to the book give each other an alibi, and the police have their work cut out to identify who is lying. The killer eventually confesses and claims self-defence, forcing Phillips to face up to past demons, while Steel finds himself not only prosecuting the offender but also defending the victim. Freema Agyeman and Ben Daniels star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: For two years, Stephanie Blake has been tormented by a cyberstalker whose e-mails have grown more intimidating over time, but without an actual physical threat against her, there is little the team can do to help. Then, the case turns into a murder investigation, and one of the officers becomes a key witness for the prosecution, but the question arises as to how far he will go to bring the right man to justice. Guest starring Anna Chancellor (Four Weddings and a Funeral).(n)

programme.title: Rising Damp
programme.desc: Lonely landlord Rigsby decides he needs help to improve his ailing love life and turns to new tenant Philip for advice. Classic comedy, starring Leonard Rossiter, Richard Beckinsale and Don Warrington.(n)

programme.title: ITV3 Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Gina Ward makes a surprise return to Aidensfield and Bellamy encounters a key informant who might come in useful - but finds himself in trouble when the man disappears before he can offer a tip-off about an imminent armed robbery. Meanwhile, Vernon acquires a bargain miniature railway which he hopes will impress the new estate manager, and it emerges Dr Liz Merrick may have feelings for Lord Ashfordly's recently appointed land agent. Tricia Penrose, Mark Jordon and Geoffrey Hughes star.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Dr Merrick faces a testing time when a terrified hospital patient claims her husband is trying to kill her, but Merton seems reluctant to get involved, while Vernon picks up a bargain all-purpose pest-control solution, enlisting David's help in his eradication mission. Gina's cousin Diane arrives to help her and Phil with the wedding preparations - much to the delight of PC Crane, who is instantly smitten. Rural drama, starring Aislin McGuckin, Tricia Penrose and Mark Jordon.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica attends a seminar in Australia and learns that she may have an inheritance claim to a piece of land there that has traditionally been used for sheep grazing. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: An intense competition between two rival yacht captains ends in murder - so Jessica tries to apprehend the culprit. Angela Lansbury stars.(n)

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: Climb the Greasy Pole - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Pop and Ma become the target of dirty tricks and smear tactics during the election campaign, and Charley is placed in a compromising position by Abigail's teacher.(n)

programme.title: Heidi
programme.desc: First of a two-part adaptation of Johanna Spyri's children's novel about an orphan who is sent to stay with her reclusive grandfather in the Swiss mountains. Noley Thornton and Jason Robards star, with Jane Seymour and Sian Phillips.(n)

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Two grieving widows lay rival claims to a corpse found washed up on the beach, each insisting it is the body of her missing husband. While it is obvious only one can be telling the truth, the detective finds it tricky to discern which of the women is lying - and why. Drama, guest starring Eleanor Bron, with Jack Shepherd.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: As the sole witness to a dying man's last words, Bobby Attfield is determined to solve the riddle they present, and forms an unlikely alliance with socialite Frankie Derwent and visiting family friend Miss Marple to help him on his quest. A trail of clues leads them to Castle Savage, where they uncover a hotbed of stifled emotion, treachery and deceit among its strange inhabitants. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast that includes Sean Biggerstaff, Samantha Bond, Richard Briers, Rafe Spall, Warren Clarke, Mark Williams, Georgia Moffett, Helen Lederer and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The glamorous Ruth Van Rydock contacts her old friend Jane Marple with a mystery - her sister Carrie Louise's study has been devastated by a suspicious fire. While Carrie Louise has the same cheerful outlook as ever, Ruth fears dark forces are at play at Stonygates, the home Carrie shares with her third husband, various relatives and a motley crew of young criminals, the latest subject of Carrie's philanthropic endeavours. But on the evening before a theatrical show is staged for their guests, one of whom is Miss Marple, an even more fascinating performance takes place before their very eyes - one where the final act is murder. Julia McKenzie stars, with guest appearances from Joan Collins, Penelope Wilton, Brian Cox, Maxine Peake, Alexei Sayle, Sarah Smart, Ian Ogilvy, Sean Hughes and Nigel Terry.(n)

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When Dr Alan Delaney is killed by a hit-and-run driver while in charge of his partner's new car, Barnaby and Jones discover the dead man had once been accused by Dr James Kirkwood of stealing a large sum of money from their Midsomer Market practice. Further investigations to uncover the whereabouts of the missing money lead the detectives to believe that Kirkwood may have been the real target. Guest starring Stephanie Cole (Doc Martin), with John Nettles and Jason Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: Brooks and Devlin investigate when former top-flight footballer Robbie Nichols is murdered in the East End of London, in what appears to be a robbery gone wrong. They question a man seen in the area on the night of the killing, who protests his innocence and points the finger at a known gangster he claims was also at the scene. With the detectives at odds over who to believe, Steel finds it increasingly difficult to prosecute the accused. Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber and Ben Daniels star.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: UK
programme.desc: High-court judge Rachel Callaghan (guest star Juliet Stevenson) is critically injured after being shot in the underground car park of her apartment. When it becomes clear a hitman was responsible, the team tries to discover who hired him. As evidence mounts against the accused, the judge's health deteriorates, and Castle is faced with a choice between friendship and respect for a person's right to die. Bill Paterson, Bradley Walsh and Freema Agyeman star.(n)

programme.title: Nijinsky's Triple Crown
programme.desc: Short sports film about the legendary race horse.(n)

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: CI5 enters a deadly race with the KGB to free a suspected double agent while he is in transit from prison to court, in the hope the action will flush out a mole operating inside the unit. Action adventure, starring Gordon Jackson, Lewis Collins and Martin Shaw.(n)

programme.title: Motorsport UK
programme.desc: Richard John Neil presents racing from Croft, featuring action from round 11 of the Ginetta GT4 Supercup and round 15 of the F4 British Championship.(n)

programme.title: The Classic Car Show
programme.desc: Quentin Willson adds the Jensen Interceptor to his list of all-time classics, while Jodie Kidd drives a 1968 Chevy Camaro along the historic Route 66 in America. Will Best heads to the seaside to see whether the public prefer the classic Fiat 500 or its modern counterpart, Alex Riley meets a compulsive collector with 190 vehicles in his garage and Bruno Senna takes a 1970 Porsche 911 ST around the test track.(n)

programme.desc: A look ahead to the day's racing at Ascot, Haydock Park and Newmarket.(n)

programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin and Francesca Cumani present coverage of today's race meetings at Ascot, Haydock Park and Newmarket.(n)

programme.title: The Man from the Alamo
programme.desc: A soldier serving at the battle of the Alamo is sent to warn his comrades' families of the impending danger, but ends up falsely branded a deserter. He tries to clear his name with acts of heroism, including tracking down the traitor who robbed the casualties after the battle was over. Western, starring Glenn Ford and Julia Adams.(n)

programme.desc: A look at the football rivalry between the nations.(n)

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave gets help from his friends at a vault auction, but Mary's inexperience leaves her empty-handed.(n)

programme.title: World Series of Darts: Auckland
programme.desc: Stephen McIvor presents a chance to see day two from the Trusts Arena in New Zealand, featuring the quarter-finals. Both Michael van Gerwen and Phil Taylor were defeated at this stage last year, losing to James Wade and Adrian Lewis respectively. Reigning world champion van Gerwen is not taking part this time around, while Taylor is in his farewell season as a professional. The Power is showing no signs of slowing down, however, having recently wrapped up an incredible 16th World Matchplay title in Blackpool, overcoming van Gerwen, Raymond van Barneveld, Adrian Lewis and Peter Wright in the process. With commentary by Stuart Pyke, Rod Harrington and Glen Larmer.(n)

programme.title: Lock Up
programme.desc: A convict is transferred to a maximum security prison, where he falls foul of a sadistic warden with a grudge against him - and who abuses his position of power to make the inmate's life a misery and destroy his good relationship with the guards. Thriller, starring Sylvester Stallone, Donald Sutherland, Darlanne Fluegel and Tom Sizemore.(n)

programme.desc: A man seeking revenge manages to trap the Chief in his office while the rest of the team are busy elsewhere. Raymond Burr stars.(n)

programme.desc: A sudden staffing crisis leaves Arthur with no choice but to employ his nephew Ray to help him sell cut-price cars from Brussels - his idea of entering the European market. Drama, starring George Cole and Gary Webster.(n)

programme.title: British Superbike Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Action from both races from Thruxton in Hampshire, where the seventh round of the season took place.(n)

programme.title: Live British Touring Car Championship
programme.desc: Steve Rider and Louise Goodman present coverage of round seven from Knockhill, where the 19th, 20th and 21st races of the season are scheduled to take place. Gordon Shedden enters this event at the top of the Drivers' Championship, but only has a two-point lead over Colin Turkington, while Rob Collard is only four points behind Shedden, so a strong performance here could prove crucial to each of their title prospects. With commentary from David Addison, Tim Harvey, Richard John Neil, Paul O'Neill and Phil Glew.(n)

programme.title: Football's Greatest: Johan Cruyff
programme.desc: A profile of the former football player and manager, who played and managed Ajax and Barcelona, and represented the Netherlands on 48 occasions, scoring 33 goals.(n)

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod attends auctions in Mission Viejo and ends up with some unusual art on his hands. Barry's accountant tries to stop him from spending too much money.(n)

programme.title: World Series of Darts: Auckland
programme.desc: Stephen McIvor presents a chance to see day three from the Trusts Arena in New Zealand, featuring the semi-finals and final. Gary Anderson was the triumphant player last year, defeating Raymond van Barneveld in the last four, before overcoming Adrian Lewis in the showpiece match. The two-time world champion returned to defend his crown this year, along with van Barneveld and the other invited PDC players Peter Wright, James Wade, Daryl Gurney, Phil Taylor, Michael Smith and Simon Whitlock. Lewis and reigning world champion Michael van Gerwen will not be taking part this time around, however. With commentary by Stuart Pyke, Rod Harrington and Glen Larmer.(n)

programme.title: American History X
programme.desc: A neo-Nazi is thrown into prison for murder and gradually comes to realise the error of his ways. On his release, he discovers his younger brother is heading down the same extremist path, and tries to stop the teenager from repeating his mistakes. Drama, starring Edward Norton, Edward Furlong, Avery Brooks, Fairuza Balk and Stacy Keach.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: The race is on to find a suitable donor to save a dying leukaemia patient. Drama, starring Haydn Gwynne, Gary Mavers and Adrian Lukis.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack congratulates himself on having got the better of Robert in the run-up to the risk-management inquiry, but just when everything seems to be going his way, he goes and causes a road accident . To make matters worse, he's been banned from driving, and shouldn't have been behind the wheel of a car in the first place, which understandably makes it hard for him to keep his mind on his job. Worried and distracted, he makes a grave error of judgement, and suddenly finds himself struggling to cover his tracks. Meanwhile, Sam finds herself on the receiving end of Christine's wrath over a malicious rumour. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack, with a guest appearance by Jane Danson's real-life partner Robert Beck.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Robert's interview with the management consultants doesn't go as planned when it ends up as a painful self-analysis of his ability as a doctor, but although his skills on the wards and in the operating theatre prove otherwise, it's enough to make the beleaguered doc hand in his resignation. Arch-enemy Jack is over the moon about the turn of events and reckons his day couldn't get any better, blissfully unaware that Christine has got her hands on a copy of an X-ray that proves his own shortcomings. Hospital drama, starring Martin Shaw, Niamh Cusack and Michael Kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister defends a British ambassador's daughter accused of murdering an Austrian journalist, and learns a harsh lesson in the realities of political and diplomatic power. Foxcott is singed by an old flame, while Matt risks his father's anger by moving into a squat. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Lena Headey, Michael Feast and Oliver Ford Davies.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick and Kate receive plenty of advice from the locals when their marriage runs into trouble and Greengrass becomes the main suspect for lead theft.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Emily finds out she is pregnant, but the joy is tempered by ill-feeling from the Jacobs family over the death of their father, who was run over by a tractor. Meanwhile, Kate enjoys peculiar cravings. Sixties-based drama, starring Nick Berry.(n)

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Nick investigates graffiti at a battery egg farm, and discovers there is more to the case than meets the eye. Meanwhile, Greengrass attracts suspicion by selling free-range eggs. Police drama, starring Nick Berry and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: Hazel Bellamy is daunted by a social invitation to spend the weekend at Somerby Park where she falls victim to a cruel prank. James's belief that she brought about her own downfall leads to her packing her bags and returning to London.(n)

programme.title: Robin of Sherwood
programme.desc: Robin is trapped on a lonely hillside by the Sheriff's men, and sacrifices his life so that Much and Marian can escape. Michael Praed stars, making his last appearance as the legendary hero.(n)

programme.title: The Grand
programme.desc: A couple plan to open a newly refurbished hotel, but finances are tight and the only person who can bail them out demands a high price. Period drama, starring Mark McGann.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Beautiful Russian aristocrat Countess Vera Rossakoff, the chief suspect in a series of jewel thefts, seemingly captivates Poirot with her charm and intellect, meaning Hastings and Miss Lemon have to do most of the actual detective work and ensure she is brought to justice. Drama, guest starring Kika Markham.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Mystery of the Spanish Chest.
programme.desc: A lavish dinner party proves to be a prelude to murder and intrigue - but fortunately Poirot is among the guests, and soon realises the key to the mystery lies in a duel fought 10 years previously. Drama, starring David Suchet, Caroline Langrishe and John McEnery.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.sub-title: The Theft of the Royal Ruby.
programme.desc: The Belgian detective looks forward to a quiet Christmas, but is disturbed by the Foreign Office when an Egyptian prince loses a famous ruby - after making the mistake of lending it to a mysterious woman. Guest starring Stephanie Cole, Nigel Le Vaillant and Tariq Alibai.(n)

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates when the body of a wildlife ranger is found on a remote island off the coast of Northumberland. Her death is at first assumed to be an accident, since she was alone on the island when she died, but marks on the body seem to point to murder. As Vera delves into the dead woman's personal life, she uncovers dark secrets and old resentments.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Former nanny Lavinia Seagram is found soaked in blood and it is believed she had turned to drink and drugs to commit suicide. However, Poirot is soon on the scent of troubled heiress Norma Restarick, who had problems of her own - not least confessing to the possibility she has killed someone herself. Guest starring Jemima Rooper, Zoe Wanamaker and Peter Bowles, with David Suchet as the Belgian sleuth.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Part one of two. The team tries to find out who was responsible for the brutal stabbing of a fellow officer, but their dogged police work is thwarted when it is proven that their main suspect is not to blame. Meanwhile, as Chief Superintendent Anderson puts pressure on Helen to close the case, Banks becomes certain that one man is the perpetrator, but when his obsession sends him over the edge, Anderson questions if he is up to the job. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson, Andrea Lowe and Caroline Catz.(n)

programme.title: DCI Banks
programme.desc: Conclusion. Officially on `gardening leave', Banks is forced to operate on the other side of the law for the first time, as he uses his years of experience to secure an all-important breakthrough in his mission to bring crime boss Steve Richards to justice. However, an unexpected turn of events pushes the grizzled DCI and his team back to square one, and Banks comes to understand a one-on-one confrontation may be his only chance to bring down Richards. Crime drama, starring Stephen Tompkinson. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Brief Encounters
programme.desc: Steph organises an exotic lingerie event at a local nightclub, but things are unlikely to run smoothly. Brian is stunned when Dawn tells him she has asked Russell to model, Steph confronts Pauline and asks why she lied to Johnny, while Barry shows Terry he knows the truth about him and Lisa. On the evening of the show, Pauline approaches Nita and gives her shocking news that leaves all the women astounded. Drama, starring Penelope Wilton, Sophie Rundle, Angela Griffin and Sharon Rooney. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mr Selfridge
programme.desc: Harry is thrown when Nancy suddenly announces they should keep their relationship professional, at least until the Selfridge Estate is finished. A grieving Mr Grove is keen to carry on as normal, but continues to shun Miss Mardle, while Grace and Gordon have an embarrassing encounter with Mr Crabb. Victor and Elsa come up with a new idea for Colleano's, Violette catches the eye of a visiting French count, and a huge `Britain at Play' promotion is launched in the store to keep the shareholders happy.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The barrister defends a British ambassador's daughter accused of murdering an Austrian journalist, and learns a harsh lesson in the realities of political and diplomatic power. Foxcott is singed by an old flame, while Matt risks his father's anger by moving into a squat. Legal drama, starring John Thaw, Lena Headey, Michael Feast and Oliver Ford Davies.(n)

programme.title: Drama Trails
programme.sub-title: Inspector Morse to Band of Gold.
programme.desc: James Nesbitt narrates the trail of links from flagship crime drama Inspector Morse, starring John Thaw as the cultured but troubled Oxford detective, to Kay Mellor's gritty Band of Gold about women struggling for dignity in Bradford's red light district.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Jack is thrilled that his plan seems to have worked, but Christine soon wipes the smile off his face when she produces the missing X-ray and forces him to confess to the misdiagnosis, while Robert gains the upper hand as he issues his arch-enemy with an ultimatum - stand down as Clinical Director or face the consequences. Medical drama, starring Martin Shaw and Niamh Cusack.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: A coach crash on the M62 causes chaos for the staff as A&E is overrun with patients needing treatment, while Sam is shocked to find her badly beaten brother waiting at reception. Elsewhere, new doctor Danny has a baptism of fire when he informs the wrong family of a patient's death - and later gets held up at gunpoint, along with Robert, by a man seeking revenge for the death of his son. Starring Martin Shaw and James Murray.(n)

programme.title: Always and Everyone
programme.desc: Dashing TV doctor James Da Costa sets pulses racing as he arrives to attend an interview for the post of clinical director, although he fails to impress his old teacher Jack, who doesn't relish working alongside his egotistical former star pupil. Meanwhile, a pregnant woman with a fractured pelvis is in danger of losing her baby and a teenage girl collapses with severe stomach pains due to liver failure. Medical drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Ben Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: The parents of a teenage murder victim ask Kavanagh to pursue a private prosecution on their behalf and he promptly agrees, despite the fact they are unemployed and unable to pay a fee. The accused is related to a powerful local crook, and finding witnesses prepared to testify proves no easy task. John Thaw stars, with Lisa Harrow and Nicholas Jones.(n)

programme.title: Peak Practice
programme.desc: Joanna feels the emotional strain of general practice when a patient she has been treating almost dies as a result of her intervention. Drama starring Fiona Gillies, Sarah Parish and Haydn Gwynne.(n)

programme.sub-title: Rhyl, North Wales v Almeria, Spain.
programme.desc: Property experts Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman meet a woman from Cheshire who has inherited a sum of money and wants to invest in a holiday rental property she and her family can also use. They help her decide between Rhyl in north Wales, which is close to her home, or Almeria in Spain, where income will potentially be higher and the sunshine more frequent.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman helps a couple who have decided to relocate, but are struggling to make up their minds about their preferred destination. Nick has his eyes on a property in the West Country, while Sarah wants them to move to the Lake Vinuela area, north of Malaga in Spain.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: A couple who are struggling to decide where they should relocate receive guidance. Graziella Clarke spent a year in Seville, Spain, during her time as a student, and would love to return to the city. However, her husband Robert is not so sure, and instead proposes a move to Dorset.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin and Jasmine Harman help a couple who spend every summer apart due to work commitments search for properties in Brighton and Cadiz. A Spanish property would allow Cheryl and Andy to spend their winters together in a warmer climate, but one of the house-hunters proves to be especially selective about their potential purchase.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: In the Lakes, farmer Pip hatches a plan to prevent the problem of lost sheep, and in the Dales, cameras follow the Dent Brewery boys as they make and distribute their craft ales.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Barber Kenny Flynn hosts the first dinner party in Liverpool. His evening has a `big kids' theme, so he prepares burger buns striped like a zebra and baby octopuses that resemble spiders. His guests are Nigerian model Cynthia Umezulike, rock music enthusiast Glen Simpson, businessman Rob Spicer and fine-dining enthusiast Jilly Pollock.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Multiple business owner Rob Spicer welcomes the diners to his home for the second party in Liverpool. He is convinced his `historical leader' theme will be a hit, but there is a shock in store as one of the guests reveals a secret about herself.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Model and barrister Cynthia Umezulike hosts the third dinner party in Liverpool, and hopes her meal including tribal fish, a traditional Nigerian jeloff and an exotic fruit platter will impress her guests.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Rock music enthusiast Glen Simpson hosts the fourth dinner party in Liverpool. He rustles up sticky blackened pork and an Elvis-inspired dessert of deep fat-fried chocolate bars with home-made peanut butter and banana ice-cream, but grievances among the guests threaten to derail the evening's entertainment.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jilly Pollock hosts the fifth and final party in Liverpool, inviting her fellow contestants to a black-tie event. She prepares a selection of self-styled dishes for her diners, including figs, hot beef and berry delight, and hopes an evening of ballroom dancing will ease tensions following the previous night's arguments.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four sets of campsite proprietors battle it out to be named best value, with the competition beginning at Amber's Bell Tent Camping in Mannington, Norfolk.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second day of the competition is at Park Farm Camping and Caravan Site in Norfolk, where husband and wife team Derek and Julie Nice are proud to show off their budget, family-friendly site. Former marksman Derek treats his guests to a spot of clay pigeon shooting, bringing out his competitive side.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to 500-year-old Layer Marney Tower in Essex for the third day of the competition, where they are welcomed into luxury glamping lodges by Nick and Sheila Charrington. The guests have little to complain about with the accommodation, but a revelation over dinner changes how they see things. Plus, a treasure hunt organised by the hosts sends one team on a wild goose chase.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Day four is at the Foxhunter Park in Kent, where brother and sister Jane Stacey and Russell Saunders own a caravan site that includes a bistro and entertainment. The accommodation is luxurious but the large scale of the site does not sit well with the campers - and the evening entertainment of a fire-eating limbo dancer leaves most of them cold.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The campers meet for the final time to find out what they thought one another's stay was worth. Amber is offended by Derek's low scoring, while he is thrown by Nick and Sheila's feedback. Russell and Jane have an axe to grind with Derek whose low scoring of their park is made worse by what they see as a personal attack on their hosting, while Nick and Sheila appear to emerge relatively unscathed.(n)

programme.title: The Royal House of Windsor
programme.desc: The royal documentary continues, charting the drama and intrigue of Prince Charles' love-life via intimate letters. In the 1970s, the Prince of Wales resolved to avoid repeating the mistakes of his great uncle, King Edward VIII, and sought advice on marriage from another great uncle - Lord Mountbatten. Taking the heir apparent under his wing, Mountbatten fashioned himself as kingmaker, and arranged a secret meeting in Paris, allowing Charles to meet his disgraced `Uncle David' in person. The prince developed a sympathetic view of the exiled king, and his example fails to stop Charles falling in love with an unsuitable woman, who ends up marrying one of her many past boyfriends. Returning to his first love, Camilla Parker Bowles - now a mother of two - stability continues to elude Charles, until pressure from all sides prompts him to turn his eye to Lady Diana Spencer.(n)

programme.title: Diana: In Her Own Words
programme.desc: Documentary featuring never-before-seen footage of Diana, Princess of Wales, recorded by her speech consultant between 1992 and 1993 as she sought to define her public persona and present her own version of events reported in the press, touching on her marriage and experience of public life. The programme also features in-depth interviews with people close to her.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests Miles Jupp and Aisling Bea. Countdown regular Susie Dent is in Dictionary Corner with Nick Helm, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers with a little help from Joe Wilkinson.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests Kathy Burke and Josh Widdicombe. Countdown regular Susie Dent is assisted in Dictionary Corner by Dara O Briain, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers with a little help from Joe Wilkinson.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: A smooth-talking priest offers Ted a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to leave Craggy Island and run his own parish in Beverly Hills, but first he has to tell Jack, Dougal and Mrs Doyle that they are not invited. Final episode of the clerical comedy, starring Dermot Morgan, with Tommy Tiernan, Jeff Harding and a cameo appearance by music star Brian Eno.(n)

programme.title: Father Ted
programme.desc: The first episode of the hit comedy. The Craggy Island cleric dreams of achieving stardom on the Faith of Our Fathers TV show - but his hopes are dashed by Jack and Dougal's untimely intervention. Dermot Morgan, Ardal O'Hanlon and Frank Kelly star.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the famous quiz, with team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson joined by guests Miles Jupp and Aisling Bea. Countdown regular Susie Dent is in Dictionary Corner with Nick Helm, while Rachel Riley provides the letters and numbers with a little help from Joe Wilkinson.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two sets of house-hunters looking for homes in Birmingham. Kirstie helps sewing blogger Elle and her fiance Ed, who have seen 52 properties and still cannot find the perfect pad. Phil helps Ben and Laura, who are relocating from Bristol. Their main concern is that they do not get stuck in suburbia.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps ballet dancer Nicol and his brother Harry get on the property ladder, exploring potential new homes in north-east London. Phil Spencer helps Tinder success story Hiren and Priyanka, who have been searching for a home for a year following a whirlwind romance.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp goes property hunting in the trendy suburb of Heaton in Newcastle, to help Tom and Liz find a new home as they are tired of renting flats. Elsewhere, Phil Spencer is in the Tyne Valley searching for a family home for couple Michael and Sorrel, who only have two months left in their current rental property.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Mushgon Dadfar hosts the first dinner party in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire, and has high hopes for her Caribbean-themed evening. However, the guests have little time to let their meal settle before they face an energetic Zumba session.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Housewife Pip Massey welcomes the diners to her home for the second dinner party of the week in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire. As a fortysomething woman who lunches and is used to entertaining, she has high hopes that all those years of practice will make her glamorous evening a success.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Landscape gardener Darren Leech hosts the third dinner party in and around Crewe and Nantwich, Cheshire. He hopes to impress his guests with fine food, including smoked haddock and black pudding, and entertainment that involves laughing at his bottom.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Student Emma Davies hosts the fourth dinner party in the Crewe and Nantwich area of Cheshire, hoping to woo her guests with a creative menu featuring stuffed pork and a home-made gnocchi starter as well as treating them to a musical performance.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hypnotherapist Russell Stubbs hosts the final dinner party in Crewe and Nantwich, Cheshire, hoping to impress his guests with a rock-night theme. In a bid to improve his chances of claiming the £1,000 prize, he prepares a meal using British produce, before the winner is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Swallows Rest in Weymouth, Dorset, where hosts Jane and Keith Smith are pulling out all the stops to win. However, the colour combinations in the rooms do not go down well with rival B&B owner Ray Chowdhury, and an afternoon of drawing starts some competition between Ray and newlyweds James and Darren Kosa-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants visit the Burley Inn in the New Forest, where newlyweds Darren and James welcome their guests. Donna and David prove to have a critical eye when they discover holes in the sheets, and Jane and Keith have a disagreement over a toilet roll. In the afternoon, the couple reveal their quizmaster skills, before Ray grills them on how they run their B&B over dinner.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Hotel Montville in Redditch, Worcestershire for the third day of the competition, where first impressions of Ray Chowdhury's unique style and decor are positive. However, room inspections leave Jane and Keith Smith threatening not to stay, and the guests grill their host about his business background at dinner. Although some light relief is given in the form of ice sculpting, breakfast disappoints James and Darren Kosa-Jones, and Ray must face the harsh reality of his guests' opinions at feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to Donna and David's Silverton B&B in Shrewsbury, where the complimentary earplugs soon have Darren and James worrying about the noise from the road outside. A Segway race helps whip up the guests' competitive spirit, Donna gets emotional when her work-life balance is questioned, and chef David proves he can handle the unexpected at breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Accusations fly around the table as payments are revealed and the winner announced. Swallows Rest is first up and hosts Jane and Keith want to find out about Ray's colour preferences. Next Darren and James of the Burley Inn quiz Ray over his fussiness around their pine furniture. When it comes to the Silverton, B&B team Donna and David take umbrage with Jane and Keith's comments.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fitness instructor Liza Macias hosts the first party in Warwickshire and hopes wooing her diners with a French menu and three hunky waiters will be enough to win her the £1,000 prize at the end of the week.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Sailor Steve Aston hosts the second dinner party in Warwickshire, hoping his nautical-themed evening will impress the women in the group and win him the £1,000 prize. But what will the ladies think when they discover the secrets of his `love ship'?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Admin manager Emma Reddin hosts the third dinner party in Warwickshire, and hopes to secure the £1,000 prize by offering her guests pea and potato samosas and a selection of Indian curries, and organising Bollywood dancing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: PA Pinky Sidhu hosts the fourth dinner party in Warwickshire, hoping to educate her guests about the finer things in life with an evening of sophistication and pageantry. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Driving instructor Alison Firth hosts the final dinner party in Warwickshire, and hopes that her 1980s disco-themed night featuring a marshmallow competition will impress her guests enough to see her win the cash prize.(n)

programme.title: The Secret Life of the Zoo
programme.desc: At Chester Zoo, Rothschild giraffe Tula is a week overdue after a 13-month pregnancy. But keepers are anxious that history could repeat itself - she gave birth to a stillborn calf last year. Cameras also follow this year's brood of penguin chicks. They are about to face the ordeal of joining the main pool, where they must compete for fish with the adult penguins. And baby silvery gibbon Eko learns how to swing between ropes - 50 feet up.(n)

programme.title: Small, Far Away: The World of Father Ted
programme.desc: Documentary first shown in 2011 following Graham Linehan and Arthur Mathews, who created Father Ted, as they embark on a road trip across Ireland in celebration of the 15th anniversary of the comedy's birth. programme.title: Unfinished Song
programme.desc: A cantankerous retiree discovers an untapped gift while wrestling with the impending death of his beloved wife in this inspirational musical drama from director Paul Andrew Williams. Arthur (Terence Stamp) has shared a fruitful and enduring marriage with his wife Marion (Vanessa Redgrave) when he receives the devastating news that their days together are numbered. But while Marion's condition might be terminal, she chooses to take the diagnosis in stride, doing her best to cherish what remaining time she has with her husband. Meanwhile, Arthur's already dour attitude grows increasingly grim with each passing day. When the senior's choir that Marion sings in shows up at their window one stormy morning to serenade them with Stevie Wonder's "You Are the Sunshine of My Life," Arthur completely loses his cool and snaps at the well-intentioned crooners. His outlook worsens right alongside Marion's health, but when she asks him to be her substitute in the choir, he agrees in an attempt to make her smile. Little does Arthur realize that choir director Elizabeth (Gemma Arterton) favors teaching the group such nontraditional tunes as Motörhead's "Ace of Spades" rather than the tired glee-club standards. In time, something remarkable happens -- Arthur finds his voice and remembers how it feels to truly be alive in the moment. Christopher Eccleston co-stars(n)

programme.title: Killing Kennedy
programme.desc: This factual drama, based on Bill O'Reilly's best-selling book Killing Kennedy: The End of Camelot, marks the 50th anniversary of the assassination of President John F Kennedy. Starring Rob Lowe as President Kennedy, Ginnifer Goodwin as Jacqueline Kennedy, Will Rothhaar as Lee Harvey Oswald and Michelle Trachtenberg as Marina Oswald, the programme charts the highs and lows of two lives that would intersect and result in two horrific murders that stunned a nation and marked the end of an era. The film combines rare historical insights and archives with dramatic and emotionally engaging storytelling to recount how a sequence of gunshots in Dallas not only killed a beloved president, but also propelled the nation into the thick of the Vietnam War and a cultural change(n)

programme.title: The Queen
programme.desc: In the wake of a national tragedy, the prime minister and royal family find themselves quietly at odds. The initial reluctance of Buckingham Palace to mourn Diana is seen by the public as a sign of cool emotional distance. But Tony Blair, perceiving a potential public-relations disaster in the making, takes it upon himself to persuade Queen Elizabeth to pay tribute to the dead princess - something that goes against the taciturn queen's usual instincts(n)

programme.title: Unlocking the Great Pyramid
programme.desc: It marks one of the greatest engineering enigmas in world history: how exactly did the builders of the Great Pyramid of Giza manage to lift limestone blocks of 2.5 tons each a distance of nearly 500 feet off the ground - without the advantage of modern technology? That riddle has inspired generations of historians and researchers to comb every interior and exterior inch of the pyramid, measuring distances and amassing data to arrive at a conclusion. But only recently have more definite answers come to light - answers that originate inside of the Pyramid. The documentary program National Geographic - Unlocking the Great Pyramid discusses this arresting theory(n)

programme.desc: Radio Days. During an audition for a morning radio show, Joey (David Coulier) begins needling Jesse (John Stamos) about personal matters. programme.title: Friends
programme.desc: The One with Two Parts. Part two of The One with the Two Parts is a hospital farce. Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) has to go to a doctor, but has no insurance. To alleviate the problem, Monica (Courteney Cox) and Rachel switch identities so that Rachel can use Monica's coverage. Complications ensue when the two become attracted to their doctors (guest stars George Clooney and Noah Wyle). Asked out on dates by the cute practitioners, Monica and Rachel begin to bicker over who will date who -- listing each other's worst attributes in front of the doctors. Meanwhile, Joey (Matt LeBlanc) and Phoebe (Lisa Kudrow) are not getting along because Joey is still dating Phoebe's twin sister, Ursula, forgetting Phoebe's birthday -- despite the fact that the identical siblings share the same birthday. Finally, Ross (David Schwimmer) is still afraid of being a father until Marcel the Monkey swallows some Scrabble tiles and Ross has to rush him to the hospital. His ability to take care of Marcel convinces him that he can handle fatherhood. This episode originally aired on February 23, 1995(n)

programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. programme.title: Father Brown

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Millionaire environmentalist and scientist Dan Hagen is shot on his boat while out at sea, and all the evidence points toward a robbery gone wrong, but DI Goodman suspects foul play by a crew member. The team soon realises the group are not as close-knit as they initially seem, and with everyone hiding a secret, the pressure is on to get to the bottom of how and why Dan was killed. The case gives the British detective a sudden desire to become a sailor, while Florence surprises the team with her action hero credentials. Caribbean crime drama, starring Kris Marshall and Josephine Jobert.(n)

programme.title: The Story of Ireland
programme.desc: Fergal Keane examines the country's invasion by Anglo-Norman forces, revealing how it mirrored huge upheavals taking place across Europe at the same time. He details how these incursions failed to suppress the Gaelic revival in the 14th century, and explores a theory that, despite her position as one of England's most celebrated rulers, Elizabeth I was threatened by continental powers that planned to usurp her throne by using Ireland as a back door into her domain.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News and Weather
programme.desc: The latest stories.(n)

programme.title: Francis Brennan's Grand Tour
programme.sub-title: Francis Brennan's Grand Vietnamese Tour: Ho Chi Minh City.
programme.desc: Francis wakes his party up early for coffee in the park before moving on to the Independence Palace. They meet Dublin-born children's rights campaigner Christina Noble> They move on to the Cao Dai Temple and the famous Cu Chi Tunnels, which proved instrumental in the outcome of the Vietnam War and present a daunting prospect to modern visitors due to torrential rain and resident bats.(n)

programme.title: The Hunt
programme.desc: Behind the scenes on the wildlife series following predators as they stalk their prey.(n)

programme.title: Bobby Jones: Stroke of Genius
programme.desc: Biopic of golfer Bobby Jones, a 14-year-old from Georgia who went on to take the sporting world by storm with his extraordinary talent until his retirement at the age of 28. His career was meteoric, but success and extreme ambition complicated his family life, and his later years were blighted by a degenerative back disorder. Starring Jim Caviezel, Claire Forlani, Jeremy Northam and Aidan Quinn. Includes Weather.(n)

programme.title: Creedon's Shannon
programme.desc: John Creedon continues his journey to the mouth of the Shannon. Along the way, he stops to descend into the deepest lough in Europe, renovate a cottage on Horse Island, and follow Cromwell's route into Ballylongford, where he visits the home of poet Brendan Kennelly. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: RTÉ News: Six One and Weather

programme.title: Reeling in the Years
programme.desc: News and music from 1975, the year that saw the IRA kidnap industrialist Tiede Herrema, leading to an armed siege at a house in Monasterevin, Co Kildare, before the Dutchman's eventual release. Other events included the death of Eamon de Valera and the election of Margaret Thatcher as the leader of Britain's Conservative Party. Featuring music by Queen, Abba, and KC and the Sunshine Band.(n)

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb
programme.desc: Premiere. Nightwatchman Larry notices that the living exhibits of his museum are behaving strangely. He discovers that the magical artefact that brings them to life is damaged, so he and his friends travel to London's Natural History Museum to find a way to restore it. Fantasy comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Rebel Wilson and Robin Williams in his final film role. Includes Lotto.(n)

Fact-based drama set in 1939, starring Aidan Quinn, Iain Glen, Marc Warren and Dudley Sutton.(n)

programme.title: A Soldier's Story
programme.desc: A drill instructor at an army base in 1940s Louisiana is killed under suspicious circumstances. A black military investigator is sent to discover the truth behind the death, only to encounter racial prejudice from the white officers and resentment from the soldiers under their command. Drama, starring Howard E Rollins Jr, Denzel Washington, Adolph Caesar and Art Evans.(n)

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Part one of two. The discovery of human remains in an urban canal is linked to the unsolved murder of a prison governor 15 years earlier, leading the team to seek out the original suspects. However, before long the prison psychologist, married to the victim's daughter, finds himself personally embroiled in the investigation. Meanwhile, Boyd launches a search for his son Luke.(n)

programme.title: The Night Shift

programme.title: Houdini & Doyle
programme.desc: Historical murder mystery starring Stephen Mangan and Michael Weston in which Arthur Conan Doyle and escape artist Harry Houdini assist the police with baffling cases that appear to have a supernatural element. Their first case finds the duo joined by Scotland Yard's first female constable to investigate the murder of a nun at one of the infamous Magdalene Laundries, where an eyewitness claims a ghost committed the crime.(n)

Can she really deprive her ex of his daughter? Sacha's daughter Rachel is brought in, and is reluctant to reveal an infected tattoo. However, when amphetamines turn up in her blood tests, dodgy skin art is the least of her dad's worries. Mary-Claire is forced to remind Harry that their new year fling was a one-off, but when they work in close proximity on a tricky case, their mutual attraction proves hard to ignore.(n)

programme.desc: Flossy, an ailing elderly woman who was previously a heart transplant patient, arrives at the ED complaining of pains in her stomach. With her is Mo, whose late son was the donor whose heart Flossy received. At the age of 80, Flossy believes she has lived a good, long life, and is ready to die, but Ethan faces an impossible dilemma as high demand leaves him without a bed in which to make Flossy's passing more comfortable. Young couple Lee and Sarah face a deadly setback in their plans to go travelling when they're involved in a car crash, while a trip to the emergency department offers Lee some much-needed perspective on his relationship. An angry patient clashes with Louise when he claims he is being `refused treatment' for what could very well be a simple case of the common cold. Medical drama, starring George Rainsford and Azuka Oforka.(n)

programme.title: The Greatest Party on Earth
programme.desc: The story of a famously lavish five-day party held by the Shah of Iran in 1971 to celebrate 2,500 years of Persian monarchy. The event was held at a specially constructed oasis surrounded by a city of tents and attended by 60 world leaders, who enjoyed a five-course banquet and a pageant featuring thousands of soldiers dressed in historical costume. However, the decadence on display had far-reaching consequences, breeding resentment of the Shah's regime among the Iranian people.(n)

programme.title: Ross Kemp: Extreme World
programme.desc: Ross Kemp heads to South Africa, 20 years after apartheid was lifted, only to discover that a new set of problems exist, such as a widening gap between rich and poor. However, as he enters the deprived township of Diepsloot on the outskirts of Johannesburg, he discovers an even bigger crisis. Rape has reached epidemic proportions in the country, with statistics showing one in two women born in South Africa will be attacked in their lifetime. Meeting victims and perpetrators, he asks how attitudes to women can change, and what the government can do to curb this abhorrent crime.(n)

programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Lord and Lady Fitzalan Howard, the owners of Carlton Towers near Selby in North Yorkshire, prepare to host a fitness boot camp weekend at their property - while also welcoming an array of guests to celebrate their son's birthday. programme.title: The Guest Wing
programme.desc: Everyday life at Northumberland's Chillingham Castle, where the members of staff try to tactfully deal with the whims of their employer, baronet Humphry Wakefield, as the estate prepares to welcome a band of ghost-hunting tourists. programme.title: The Guest Wing

programme.title: The British
programme.desc: The development of London during the Victorian era, as the city at the heart of the British empire rapidly expanded - and social divisions became increasingly pronounced. The programme explores the grandeur of the period, including the building of the Crystal Palace, as well as sharp rises in vice and crime that prompted outrage among reformers including Charles Dickens and Josephine Butler. There is also a look at how football became increasingly popular.(n)

programme.title: The British

programme.title: A Plastic Tide

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: Immigration officials are worried about the mental health of a Korean girl who arrives at Sydney Airport with very little money and no idea of how she will support herself.(n)

programme.title: Nothing to Declare
programme.desc: A Chinese national is quizzed about his place of birth. Meanwhile, officers become suspicious regarding a Ferrari and its possible contents.(n)

programme.title: Stop, Search, Seize
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Ireland's border force officers as they fight to stop gangs of organised smugglers from bringing drugs, money, guns, cars and even exotic animals into the country.(n)

programme.title: Chicago Fire
programme.desc: Casey and Severide disagree on a potential arson case when the squad fails to save a woman from her burning house.(n)

programme.title: How to Get Away with Murder
programme.desc: The mystery of the flyers takes a surprising turn, Frank's troubled past comes to light and a shocking new discovery changes everything about the night of the fire.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: Following the sudden death of BAU Section Chief Erin Strauss, there's an air of uncertainty among the team, with Hotch tipped to take her place. However, before a decision is made, there's a case in need of immediate attention - the bodies of two women have been found in Arizona, both shot in the heart and made to look like they are praying.(n)

programme.title: Criminal Minds
programme.desc: The agents hold a delusional man in custody for the multiple murders of women who have cheated on their partners, but the discovery of the suspect's doppelganger forces a major re-evaluation of their investigation. Guest starring Camryn Manheim and Fred Koehler.(n)

programme.title: Police Academy 6: City Under Siege
programme.desc: The clueless cops return yet again, this time to thwart the machinations of a crime lord behind a wave of raids and robberies in the city. Unfortunately, they are unaware Mr Big is always one step ahead thanks to a police informer. Penultimate entry in the comedy series, starring Bubba Smith, David Graf, Michael Winslow, Matt McCoy and Leslie Easterbrook.(n)

programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes: Special
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the sci-fi action sequel, starring Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn.(n)

programme.title: Norbit
programme.desc: A timid man's life is ruined after he is bullied into marrying an overbearing, overweight woman. However, a more hopeful future beckons when he bumps into his childhood sweetheart and realises she is his one true love - but first he has to pluck up the courage to confront his tyrannical wife. Comedy, starring Eddie Murphy in multiple roles alongside Thandie Newton, Cuba Gooding Jr and Terry Crews.(n)

programme.title: The Intern
programme.desc: A retiree grows tired of the quiet life and becomes an intern at a start-up run by a beautiful entrepreneur, and teaches the young staff a few things about successful business. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Anne Hathaway and Rene Russo.(n)

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A by-the-book Los Angeles cop is paired with a laidback new partner to investigate the nefarious activities of a TV evangelist and a pornographic-magazine baron suspected of operating a criminal cult. Comedy spoof of the 1950s TV series, starring Dan Aykroyd, Tom Hanks, Christopher Plummer and the original show's star Harry Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: When it becomes obvious that his solo album is a flop, a former boy band member does everything he can to maintain his celebrity status. Comedy, starring Andy Samberg, Jorma Taccone and Akiva Schaffer.(n)

programme.desc: The indomitable Irish matriarch discovers that a plan is afoot by developers to buy the famous Dublin street market where her family has run a fruit and veg stall for generations. Assembling a band of eccentric allies, she plans to fight back, only to realise her daughter is not interested in taking over the family business. Comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll and Jennifer Gibney.(n)

programme.title: Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo
programme.desc: A lowly fish-tank cleaner working at a gigolo's luxurious house has his eyes opened to a completely new way of life - but an accident with his employer's prized pets puts him into a tricky situation. Desperate to raise a quick buck, he is soon entertaining a series of increasingly sex-crazed women. Comedy, starring Rob Schneider, William Forsythe, Eddie Griffin, Oded Fehr and Gail O'Grady.(n)

programme.title: Bad Bromance
programme.desc: Dan Landsman prepares to attend a high-school reunion, and hopes to make a good impression on people who never had any time for him in his teens. To that end, he tracks down a famous classmate to persuade him to attend - but is unprepared for the consequences of letting the celebrity into his life. Comedy, starring Jack Black and James Marsden.(n)

programme.title: Police Academy 7: Mission to Moscow
programme.desc: Commandant Lassard sends the incompetent cops to Russia to help their counterparts capture an elusive criminal mastermind who uses his genius with computers to pull off a series of daring robberies. Comedy sequel, starring George Gaynes, Michael Winslow, David Graf, Leslie Easterbrook and Christopher Lee.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: All About Steve
programme.desc: A single crossword compiler goes on a blind date with a news cameraman and is instantly smitten, but he is less keen. When her infatuation gets her fired from her job, she devotes herself to pursuing him across America, determined to convince him they are meant for each other. Romantic comedy, with Sandra Bullock, Bradley Cooper and Thomas Haden Church.(n)

programme.title: Three Amigos
programme.desc: Three silent Western movie stars are summoned to Mexico for what they think will be a public appearance - only to discover the locals really believe in their heroic abilities and expect them to rid their town of a group of evil bandits. Comedy, starring Steve Martin, Chevy Chase and Martin Short.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: A feminist FBI agent is sent undercover as a contestant in the Miss United States pageant when the event becomes the target of a terrorist bomb threat. As she is not exactly catwalk material, a veteran British coach is brought on board to oversee her transformation into a glamorous beauty queen. Comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen and William Shatner.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality 2: Armed and Fabulous
programme.desc: FBI agent Gracie Hart is taken off active duty and made the face of the bureau's publicity campaign, but would rather catch crooks than be the focus of media attention - so when her friends are kidnapped, she disobeys orders to run her own undercover investigation with the help of a short-tempered colleague. Comedy sequel, starring Sandra Bullock, Regina King, William Shatner and Heather Burns.(n)

programme.title: Hot Tub Time Machine
programme.desc: A man suffering a midlife crisis tries to recapture his lost youth by going back to his old haunts with two equally unhappy friends and his teenage nephew. They end up being transported back to 1986 and are tempted to give themselves the lives they always wanted - despite warnings that they must not change anything. Sci-fi comedy, starring John Cusack, Clark Duke, Craig Robinson and Rob Corddry.(n)

programme.title: Dad's Army
programme.desc: The officious captain of a seaside town's home guard platoon tries to maintain the reputation and morale of his troops as the Second World War draws to a close. He finds himself dealing with the hunt for a German spy as well as a female journalist sent to report on the exploits of the brave but bumbling soldiers. Comedy based on the TV series, starring Toby Jones, Bill Nighy and Catherine Zeta-Jones.(n)

programme.title: Brewster's Millions
programme.desc: A baseball player is stunned to learn he has come into a massive inheritance. Unfortunately, there is one condition - he must somehow find a way to spend $30million in just one month, or he will lose the lot. Meanwhile, two scheming lawyers, who stand to get the money if he fails, are determined to sabotage his efforts. Comedy, starring Richard Pryor, John Candy, Lonette McKee and Jerry Orbach.(n)

programme.title: Now You See Him, Now You Don't
programme.desc: A science student creates an invisibility spray, an invention that could help save his college from financial ruin - but it soon attracts the attention of a gang of scheming crooks wanting to use it for more dishonest ends. Disney adventure, sequel to The Computer Wore Tennis Shoes, starring Kurt Russell, Cesar Romero, Joe Flynn and Jim Backus.(n)

programme.title: The Good Dinosaur
programme.desc: In a world where the asteroid impact that wiped out the dinosaurs never happened, humans have evolved as a primitive species while the giant lizards remain the dominant life form on Earth. A young apatosaurus becomes separated from his family, but finds a friend in a feral human boy as he makes the dangerous journey home. Pixar animated adventure, with the voices of Raymond Ochoa and Jack Bright.(n)

programme.title: Finding Dory
programme.desc: Nemo and dad Marlin set out on an underwater adventure to help their forgetful friend Dory find her parents. Animated sequel, with the voices of Ellen DeGeneres, Albert Brooks and Ed O'Neill.(n)

programme.title: The Jungle Book
programme.desc: A boy is raised by animals in the jungles of India, but his carefree life is threatened by the return of a fierce tiger with a grudge against humans. The youngster faces a difficult choice between remaining with his friends or returning to his own people. Live action remake of Disney's animated adventure based on Rudyard Kipling's stories, starring Neel Sethi, with the voices of Bill Murray, Ben Kingsley and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop
programme.desc: Five Green Berets stationed in Vietnam grudgingly undertake a bizarre mission - to help their native hosts by transporting a fully-grown elephant through 200 miles of rough jungle terrain. They soon hit upon a novel way of delivering the beast, deciding to load it into a plane, and then parachute it to its destination. Comedy, starring Danny Glover, Ray Liotta, Denis Leary and Doug E Doug.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. As the cub grows to adulthood, he receives a vision of the dead king, who inspires him to seek revenge and reclaim his rightful throne. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Man's Chest
programme.desc: Wily rogue Captain Jack Sparrow finds an old debt coming back to haunt him. Years before, he sold his soul to the legendary Davy Jones, who has now risen from the depths of the ocean to collect what he is owed - with a giant sea monster at his command. Meanwhile, ruthless trader Lord Beckett is intent on seizing control of the Caribbean, and sets out to turn Jack and his allies against one another. Swashbuckling adventure sequel, starring Johnny Depp, Orlando Bloom, Keira Knightley, Jack Davenport and Bill Nighy.(n)

programme.title: The Finest Hours
programme.desc: An oil tanker suffers devastating damage while caught in a fierce Atlantic storm, which breaks the vessel in two. While an engineer tries to keep the crew members trapped in the sinking wreckage alive, members of the Coast Guard brave the deadly conditions to come to their rescue. Fact-based disaster movie, starring Chris Pine, Casey Affleck and Eric Bana.(n)

programme.title: Glory Road
programme.desc: A basketball coach takes over a college team in 1960s Texas, but his decision to recruit black people causes uproar. Determined to enlist the best players possible, he sets out to lead his team to the national championships. Sporting drama based on a true story, starring Josh Lucas, Jon Voight and Derek Luke.(n)

programme.title: The Shaggy DA
programme.desc: A boy who once turned into a dog grows up to become a principled lawyer, who runs for district attorney. However, as he campaigns against the crooked current DA, he finds himself once again undergoing a canine transformation and must find out the cause while keeping his condition a secret. Sequel to Disney comedy The Shaggy Dog, starring Dean Jones and Suzanne Pleshette.(n)

programme.title: Operation Dumbo Drop

Comedy, starring Danny Glover, Ray Liotta, Denis Leary and Doug E Doug.(n)

programme.title: Zootropolis
programme.desc: In a city populated by animals, a rabbit achieves her dream of becoming the first bunny to become a police officer - but faces prejudice at every turn. When the disappearance of an otter hints at a terrible conspiracy in the city, she enlists the aid of a con-artist fox in solving the mystery. Disney animated comedy, with the voices of Ginnifer Goodwin, Jason Bateman and Idris Elba.(n)

programme.title: Brave
programme.desc: A princess defies her mother's plans to secure peace by marrying her off to the son of one of their allies. A witch provides the rebellious royal with a magic spell to change her fate, but the enchantment backfires disastrously when the queen is transformed into a bear. Pixar's animated fantasy, with the voices of Kelly Macdonald, Emma Thompson and Billy Connolly.(n)

programme.title: The Lion King
programme.desc: A lion prince blames himself for his father's death and flees into the wilderness, leaving his wicked uncle to take over. Disney animated musical, featuring the voices of Matthew Broderick, Jeremy Irons, Rowan Atkinson, Whoopi Goldberg and James Earl Jones.(n)

programme.title: Monsters, Inc
programme.desc: Two monsters work for an energy firm that employs scary creatures to sneak into children's bedrooms and convert their screams into power. However, when a little girl accidentally wanders into the pair's domain, they have to race against time to return her safely home before anyone finds out. Pixar animated comedy, with the voices of John Goodman, Billy Crystal, Steve Buscemi and James Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Lady and the Tramp
programme.desc: A pet cocker spaniel fears her owners will reject her when they become parents, and the arrival of two villainous siamese cats in the house leaves her feeling more unwelcome. Driven from her home, she encounters a roguish stray mongrel, who introduces her to his carefree life on the streets. Disney animated adventure, with the voices of Barbara Luddy, Larry Roberts and Peggy Lee.(n)

programme.title: Alice Through the Looking Glass
programme.desc: Alice returns to the magical world of Underland and takes a journey back in time to save her friends. Fantasy adventure sequel, starring Mia Wasikowska and Johnny Depp.(n)

programme.title: Queen Of Katwe
programme.desc: The life of a poor Ugandan youngster is changed forever when she is introduced to the game of chess. Drama, starring David Oyelowo, Lupita Nyong'o and Madina Nalwanga.(n)

programme.title: Arthur & Merlin
programme.desc: An evil druid wreaks havoc on ancient Britain, determined to wipe out the Celtic people. A young warrior who has been driven into exile joins forces with a hermit wizard to stop his reign of terror and save their people from annihilation. Fantasy adventure, starring Kirk Barker and Stefan Butler.(n)

programme.title: The Legend Of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving his old home behind, Tarzan is lured back to Africa and into a trap. Adventure, starring Alexander Skarsgard, Margot Robbie and Samuel L Jackson.(n)

programme.title: Jason Bourne
programme.desc: Former government operative Jason Bourne is drawn out of hiding to uncover more truths about his father, while CIA director Robert Dewey orders his head of cyber-security to hunt him down. Action thriller, starring Matt Damon, Tommy Lee Jones, Alicia Vikander and Julia Stiles.(n)

programme.title: Days of Thunder
programme.desc: An arrogant racing driver is determined to seize the reigning Nascar champion's crown, winning the Indianapolis 500 in the process. However, his first few races see him intimidated by the surroundings and unable to finish due to crashes or blown engines. A serious accident compounds his misfortunes and jeopardises his chances of ever racing again. Drama, starring Tom Cruise, Nicole Kidman, Robert Duvall, Randy Quaid and John C Reilly.(n)

programme.title: Hitman
programme.desc: A genetically engineered assassin, who exists at the beck and call of a mysterious organisation, fails in his latest mission, and becomes a target himself, as security forces worldwide become aware of his existence and a rival agent is assigned to tie up loose ends. Action thriller, starring Timothy Olyphant, Dougray Scott and Olga Kurylenko.(n)

programme.title: Last Action Hero
programme.desc: A boy watching an action movie is transported into the film by a magic ticket and meets its hero figure, who refuses to believe he is a fictional character. Matters take a turn for the worse when the screen villain gets hold of the ticket and crosses over into the real world - where bad guys can win. Comedy adventure, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Austin O'Brien, Charles Dance, F Murray Abraham and Anthony Quinn.(n)

programme.title: Warcraft
programme.desc: Conflict erupts between the defenders of a kingdom and an invading horde that has travelled from a dying world. Fantasy adventure based on the best-selling computer game, starring Travis Fimmel, Paula Patton and Ben Foster.(n)

programme.title: The Legend Of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving his old home behind, Tarzan is lured back to Africa and into a trap. Adventure, starring Alexander Skarsgard, Margot Robbie and Samuel L Jackson.(n)
